description:
Rob Beckett – Giraffe, Comedian, presenter and panel-show superstar announces new tour Giraffe for 2025.

Smashing the life out of the M25, M1, M5 and any other road that’s in my way. From Bromley to Brisbane, my new show Giraffe is going worldwide.

Expectations on me: put on 3 stone from takeaways and post-show drinking.

Expectations of you: leave the gig happier than when you arrived.

My wife thinks it’s going to be tough for me to be away from the family, and don’t get me wrong, I do love my children/podcast content providers… but I also enjoy a lie-in and a hotel buffet breakfast. I think I’ll cope.

What else is there to do? Sit next to your partner on the sofa, scrolling TikTok in silence again? You did that the last three nights. See you there!

Host of Sky’s Rob Beckett’s Smart TV and Rob & Romesh Vs. He’s also the unmistakable voice of Channel 4’s Celebs Go Dating and the smash-hit podcast Parenting Hell.

“Hilarious” – The Mirror

“Naturally funny” – The Times

“Hilariously observational comic… brings roars of laughter” – Arts Desk
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Red!, Red!
Step into a world where fairy tales come alive with imagination, music, and creative collaboration. Lucy Mulgan’s Red! The Opera—a fresh and engaging retelling of Little Red Riding Hood—invites audiences of all ages to experience opera in a new, interactive way.

This vibrant one-act opera takes the well-loved story and gives it a bold, modern twist. Red is no longer a passive heroine but a spirited and resourceful young girl who learns to stand up for herself. Along the way she encounters a mischievous Wolf, a feisty Granny, and a host of colourful characters who bring the forest to life with humour, warmth, and plenty of surprises.

At the heart of Red! is participation. Children take an active role in shaping the performance—creating sound effects, movements, and responses that become part of the show. Their voices blend with professional singers and musicians, making every performance unique and alive with energy. The result is a joyful celebration of music, storytelling, and community.

Mulgan’s score is witty, playful, and sophisticated, full of catchy rhythms, lyrical arias, and imaginative textures. It captures the drama and comedy of the tale while remaining approachable and fun for newcomers to opera. Both seasoned opera-goers and first-time audiences will find themselves swept up in the sparkle and charm of this inventive work.

With its empowering message, interactive spirit, and musical brilliance, Red! is an opera for today’s families—offering laughter, excitement, and a reminder that even the smallest voices can make themselves heard.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Saturday Laughs with Michael Macaulay and Lana Walters, Saturday Laughs is a comedy showcase with top Kiwi comedians from around the country, right in the heart of Wellington at Fringe Bar!

This month features headline act Lana Walters
Winner of the Billy T award, Lana is a fabulous standup comedian, television writer and improviser. A regular panelist on 7Days and The Project, you may have also seen her in the Best Foods Comedy Gala or The Great Comedy Debate. As well as all this, Lana is a mum of two young kids giving her endless material and sleepless nights.

With MC Michael Macaulay
Michael started in comedy in the late 90s, eventually winning the Becks Beer award for Best Newcomer at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2001. After a nearly 20 year hiatus he returned to comedy in a totally different country and having learned no life lessons at all.
Since then he has twice been nominated for ‘Best MC’, in the Welly Awards; won his own Welly in 2020 for being an all-round nice person; and performs up and down Aotearoa.

Also featuring
Gabby Anderson
Ralph Hilaga
and more!

description:
Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson, Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson
Saturday Laughs returns to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club, with another great line up of top Kiwi comedy

With MC Ben Hurley
As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

And headline act Josh Thomson
Josh is a household name and a legend on the New Zealand comedy scene. He has been a mainstay on local comedy shows like 7Days, Have You Been Paying Attention, was the regular comedian on The Project and was the champion of Season 3 of TaskMaster NZ – which he now directs. He also directed and starred in a web series about his own father Subject:Dad.

As an actor he’s appeared internationally in Prime’s The Office Australia, Netflix’s The New Legends Of Monkey, NBC’s Young Rock and local hits Good Grief, Creamerie, Wellington Paranormal, Educators, Time Bandits and the Emmy winning INSiDE. His feature film work includes the How to Please a Woman (Australia), Don’t Make Me Go (US), and local favourites Gary of the Pacific, Pork Pie, & Guns Akimbo.

Josh continues to work as a live performer, whether gigging on tour with 7DaysLive, appearing on the Comedy Gala, hosting the Great Comedy Debate or as an MC for corporate events. He’s hosted the NZ Film Awards, the 48Hour Film awards, various Vodafone events and several spots for the NZ Music awards.

Support from
Li'i Alaimoana
Sera Devcich
Katy Borrows

Book early and often!

This event made possible with support from the Upper Hutt Creative Communities scheme, and Aotearoa Gaming Trust
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
One Bedroom Available In Super Friendly Definitely Not Scary Flat, Room Available – Viewings This Week Only!

Step inside. Swallow your fate. Hope the lights stay on.

You’re invited to a flat viewing unlike any other, one that takes you deep into the haunting heart of Aotearoa’s rental crisis. In this fully immersive, site-specific theatre experience, BATS Theatre becomes the flat, and you - the hopeful viewer - are here to secure a room.

But something isn’t right. The tenants are strange. The landlord is unseen but all-powerful. And there’s a bowl of jellybeans by the door...

As you are guided through a tour of the building, you'll discover a world where landlords hold supernatural control, and tenants find themselves trapped in a never-ending cycle of rent, sacrifice, and submission.

Darkly funny, chillingly dystopian, and disturbingly familiar, this intimate experience blurs the line between theatre and real estate.

Book your “viewing” now, spaces are very limited. Also, be warned - once you enter, the flat might never let you leave.

“The viewing is anything but boring.” - Brie Keatley - Art Murmurs
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Scene Painting, Scene Painting
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's the final show of the 2025 New Zealand Improv Festival, and we're bringing together some of our favourite performers for a once-in-a-lifetime show.

Improvisers will often paint a scene, using narration to conjure images in the mind of the audience. But what if they could actually paint the scene?

Thanks to the generous support of Resene Paints, we'll be doing just that: actually painting our scenes onto the stage and walls at BATS. Come send off the Festival with a messy, beautiful explosion of colour!

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Journey into Om, Yoga without mantra is a bit like cake without the icing !
By now we all know that everything essentially is vibration. Yoga knew this 1000's of years ago, that is why sound is the first tool of Yoga.
Learn about the pranavah mantra ( om) as it relates to your Yoga Practice.
In this 2-hour workshop, you will understand the traditional and respectful way to use this sacred sound: both theoretically and practically.
We will draw on the ancient texts of Yoga as our point of reference.
The use of a mantra is a powerful tool for healing, emotional and mental clarity, and spiritual development. You will be guided in a variety of accessible practices to experience the effects of this mantra.
This workshop can open new dimensions to your practice, or it is also a great way to start on the Yoga Journey.
I teach from the Viniyoga tradition of Krishnamacharya, where mantra is used as an integral aspect of Yoga, whether it be asana, pranayama, or meditation.
This workshop will be nourishing to all the dimensions -heart, mind, and body.
You do not need to be a singer at all-just be willing to have a go at making a sound, even in your head if out loud feels too weird.

THE DEVILS ARE COMING, After a sell-out first go of it WE ARE BACK with our hit late night sketch comedy brought to you by RUFF AS GUTZ- a local theatre company behind the MILK saga, Hardly Workin'!, DOGS IN THE HOLE and other things, I'm sure.
This could be considered a curated scratch night. It could also be considered a low-budget SNL. One thing's for sure: It's happening and it's happening SOON. 
Hosted by local devil Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin, and featuring some of Wellingtons up-and-comers, this show is a new ensemble premiering works to make people either laugh or at least exhale out their nose a little.

description:
Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days, Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days
Get a close look and hands on experience with machinery of yesteryear. Weather permitting, we will have our Fowler Traction engine in steam too!

Find the machine that was used to make the 1950 Empire Games medals. Many of the machines have a association with the Wellington area.

Take a nostalgic trip through the vintage kitchen and other displays of household, and retail items from the past. Wellington Vintage Machinery is housed in an old Cheese Factory built in 1925. The factory has had an interesting past from cheese factory, to milk bottling plant, munitions store during WWII, and other uses before becoming home for the vintage machinery.

The building is one of the few remaining dairy factories designed by architects Duffill & Gibson of Hawera and built by CE Roebuck of New Plymouth.


Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/wellington-vintage-machinery-open-days-25/


Health & Safety:
Please wear closed toe footwear and keep an eye on any children that you bring along.

Most of the display is wheelchair accessible, and an accessible toilet facility is also available.

The Night is Always Darkest, Created and performed by Lia Kelly
The Night is Always Darkest returns after a sold out season at NZ Fringe! Spend a night with Lia as she fills the sleepless hours of the morning in real-time.
Get to know her and influence her decisions in this award-nominated durational theatre experience. Attend the show live or tune into our live streams on Twitch and YouTube.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, The Art of Ikebana exhibition
Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.

Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.

Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm

Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.

This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Amber Temple at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington, The Amber Temple marries mysticism with gritty, ghoulish escapades of rogues and renegades. Vignettes of characters similar to you, similar to me, similar to someone you may have been or may one day become, all on the path towards the Amber Temple.
From the bowels of the molten earth, to the jowls of the predatory opportunist, to the angel casting light from celestial constellations, you will find yourself wrapped in a web from a sliver of time, a faraway place, perhaps an unknown space, as musician and dancer weave their tall tales of trials and tribulations, mortal life and looming death, unwavering love and venomous hate, environmentalism and satirical social commentary.
An original music and interpretive dance collaboration between singer-songwriter Julian Temple and contemporary dancer Amber Stephens.
Temple, known mostly for his work in the eponymous Julian Temple Band has written all new works for the project while Stephens, a trained contemporary ballet dancer and choreographer who ran her own dance company in Vienna, has choreographed the interpretive dance for this unique performance.
“A live dancer added a visceral element to an already emotional performance. Having a responsive artist interacting and interpreting the music through movement only heightened the experience. It bridged the gap between performer and audience.”
- Ed Castelow - Dictaphone Blues
“You’ll be a converted fan of The Amber Temple before they’ve even finished their first song. There’s an obvious sense of originality, coupled with carefully crafted dance moments and some of the most intense and outstanding folk songwriting you’ve heard. There’s a feeling though that nothing is premeditated and that improvisation is the star of the show - the kind of performance that requires decades of experience. Luckily for us, Julian and Amber have this in spades. Do yourself a favour, I guarantee you’ve seen nothing like it.”
- Sam Cullen - Singer/Songwriter
“Even having an understanding of the type of show The Amber Temple would be putting on when booking them - I was blown away by the amount of drama, tension and world-building Julian & Amber are able to accomplish in such an agile performance. The Amber Temple is a totally unique and utterly engaging experience which should be seen and celebrated.”
- Chris Scott - Seaside Music
Show starts at 7 Presale tickets $20 (+BF) via undertheradar.co.nz or $25 on the door
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”
label: Arts & Theatre

description: Insect Macro Photography Workshop: A Tiny World, A hands-on workshop on the art of insect macro photography. Learn how to capture stunning close-up details of insects and other small creatures in a garden setting. This class will cover specialized camera settings, lighting techniques, and composition to reveal the intricate beauty of the natural world.

description:
The Monster in the Maze, The myth of the Minotaur is a tale almost as old as storytelling itself, but with The Monster in the Maze Jonathan Dove and Alisdair Middleton have excavated rich, new life from this classic. In this brand new staging by director Anapela Polataivao (Red White and Brass, Wild Dogs Under My Skirt), this story will be told as never before.

When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he metes out his punishment in the cruellest way possible: by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth, to be fed to the terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze: the Minotaur. As King Minos triumphs, his great monster “will eat your future, it will rip your hope, it will stamp your youth, your children in the sand.”

As the vindictive king will soon learn, however, these youth will not accept their fate without a fierce challenge. The Monster in the Maze is a story about resistance; about justice; about finding power not in oppression, but in collectivism. Fittingly, then, it’s also a groundbreaking work in its form: a community-focused and community-driven opera in which young and community singers and players stand proudly shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts, and in which both are integral.

The Monster in the Maze has been roundly praised by audiences, participants and reviewers worldwide, and in its Aotearoa debut season, it will serve as a gorgeous articulation of New Zealand Opera’s reciprocal community kaupapa.

Sung in English with surtitles.

The Satire We Deserve: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies | Writers on Mondays, Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia.

Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders' association in Star Gazers.
Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks, and why it's a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

Lord of the Rings played with the Friends theme tune on repeat?

Music can make or break a blockbuster.

Let's see what happens when we devilishly mess with the soundtrack for an hour featuring some of the world's best visiting improvisers!

Expect awkward silences, melodramatic moments, powerful pauses, and guffaws galore as the music makes everything better (we hope).

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz

description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.

description:
Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.

Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.

Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. Louise Pirini - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. Peter Holmes - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. Dan Young - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. Andrew Webber - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!

description:

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

description:
Manage Your Expectations, Created and Performed by Eliza Sanders
Produced by House of Sand
Directed by Charley Allanah

You decide the ending…

Solo performer Eliza Sanders has a simple task: to tell you everything that will happen in the show, so you can decide if you would like to see it. Nothing is ever so simple.

This genre-defying work of dance, theatre, live film, clown and absurd philosophising takes the idea of the ‘trigger warning’ to its absurdist extreme to question how ‘informed’ consent can really be, and asking ‘How much do you really want to know?’

Created and performed by multi-award-winning maverick of the stage Eliza Sanders, Manage Your Expectations helps us to see the limits of the power to communicate and our failures to say what we mean. Through movement, multimedia, and razor-sharp wit, it examines the impossibility of perfect communication, musing on the influence of context, identity and personal history while creating something beautiful from our collective mess.

“Clever, witty, evocative, subversive, immersive, despairing, poignant, personal and universal” — Deirdre Tarrant, Theatreview

“Beautifully vulnerable” – Chloe Jaques, Theatreview, 2024

Full of vigour, energy, chaos and a hint of confrontation, Manage Your Expectations is a mind (and body) bending show about how we connect in an increasingly complex world. And you decide the ending…

Content warning: this show contains explicit content, mild coarse language, heavy nudity, themes of abortion and rape.

WINNER: Best Performer, Whangārei Fringe 2024

WINNER: San Diego Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024

description:
Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets, Witness a defining moment in this country’s jazz scene as the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) makes its highly anticipated debut at Meow Nui.
Born from a collective vision championed and inspired by jazz legend Rodger Fox, AoJO represents the shared aspirations of the jazz community – honouring our jazz lineage while serving as a platform for its future. This newly formed, and proudly national ensemble brings our country’s jazz talent and legacy into focus.
Led by Musical Director John Rae and Concert Master Oscar Lavën, with Mike Taylor (lead trumpet) and Kaito Walley (lead trombone), this concert features Duke Ellington and Billy Strayhorn’s vibrant reimagining of Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite. A groundbreaking fusion of classical and jazz, it’s hailed as one of Ellington’s most inventive works. Together Strayhorn and Ellington showcase the familiar themes of Tchaikovsky’s ballet through the expressive power of jazz in orchestral form.
Prepare to be captivated by lush orchestration and melodic innovation as the AoJO takes to the stage for the very first time.

description:
Annual Compliance Forum 2025 - Wellington, Solving Compliance Together – From Chaos to Confidence

Audience: IQPs | Facility Managers | Council Staff
Purpose: To deliver updates, explore common compliance gaps, and model a solution pathway through real-time, cross-role collaboration.
Your Host: Rosemary (Rosie) Killip
Rosie is the go-to expert in building compliance training. With over 30 years of experience breaking down complex rules into actionable insights, she has been a trusted authority in the field since the 1990s. As the founder of Building Networks in 2000, Rosie has dedicated her career to making building law accessible and practical—whether on an international platform or right here in New Zealand.
Plenary: Compliance in 2025 – What’s Changed & What Still Trips Us Up
Start the day with a high-level overview of recent changes in compliance legislation, audit findings, and council trends. We’ll explore how the same problems show up differently for IQPs, FMs, and Council staff, and introduce the 5-Step Compliance Navigator Blueprint to help untangle the chaos.

Session 1: Group Problem Solving – “Start with the Schedule”
Activity: Fix the Faulty Building
Join a mixed-role group and work through a fictional building scenario with missing links, handover gaps, and a messy compliance schedule.
Facilitators will rotate with role-based prompts as you:
Identify what’s gone wrong
Map who's missing what
Explore how the CLARITY phase of the Blueprint can get things back on track

Debrief: The Real Cost of Getting it Wrong
Explore real-world case studies of where compliance failed, from fines to stand-offs to failed inspections.
This session highlights how better role clarity and cross-role collaboration could have prevented most issues.

Session 2: Step Into Clarity – Your Blueprint in Action
Format: Guided Workshop
Get hands-on with the first step of the Compliance Navigator Blueprint: CLARITY.
Through self-assessment, small-group reflection, and practical tools, you’ll uncover where your current system is falling short, and how to start fixing it.
You’ll receive:
A CLARITY self-assessment questionnaire
A sample Roles & Responsibilities Matrix
A “Top 10 Common Gaps” cheat sheet
A quick-start guide to the 5-Step Blueprint
Walk away with a clearer picture of your compliance gaps—and the confidence to tackle them.

Final Session: Your Compliance Compass – Staying Aligned Over Time
Format: Mini-Workshop
Compliance doesn’t fail because people don’t care, it fails when teams fall out of alignment.
In this closing session, you’ll reflect on how to stay connected across roles, adapt to change, and keep compliance on track.
Using a simple but powerful worksheet, you’ll map:
What you know vs. what you’ve assumed
Who’s responsible
What’s changing
You’ll leave with a simple monthly or quarterly alignment ritual you can take back to your team.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington, Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington
Register Today by contacting Crown Leadership International Group: Website: www.crownleadership.com.au Phone: +64 9 889 7217

About this Event

Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

Online: The Zoom link will be sent out the day before the event.
About this event:
About this event:

This highly interactive session will have engaging discussions that will uncover practical insights into creating user – focused, unified digital services that genuinely enhance customer experiences. We will discuss the complexities of web design and development, exploring them from a project delivery perspective, with a focus on building effective and impactful digital solutions.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:
 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. As a digital agency, they create user-focused digital experiences that are both functional and visually engaging. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. Their expertise lies in simplifying complex information through thoughtful, user – centred design. As an approved supplier on New Zealand’s Government Marketplace, they have led key projects for a range of clients across the public and enterprise sectors. Pikselin is known for its collaborative approach and commitment to elevating digital experiences that truly serve New Zealanders. 

Steve Barnard Managing Director Steve leads client and partner collaborations at Pikselin, overseeing projects from marketing to post-development support with over 30 years of experience in New Zealand's IT industry.

James Guthrie Tech Lead James transforms complex design requirements into maintainable accessible code specializing in real-time data visualization interactive mapping, and fully accessible cross device websites.

Brian Smith Design Director Brian leads Pikselin's creative vision collaborating with clients and the creative team to deliver exceptional products and services.

description:
Dealing With Difficult People & Situations, Transform conflict and difficult situations with co-workers and customers into opportunities by equipping your staff with the skills and techniques required to manage these situations with confidence, professionalism, and pride. Learn ways to resolve conflict with customers and co workers, influence successful outcomes and develop a peaceful workplace. We have all experienced the stress that comes from having unresolved conflicts with our customers and co-workers. Conflicts that are ignored or resolved poorly don’t go away, they cause people to feel resentful and to avoid each other. The effects on the business are a loss of productivity, turnover, and absenteeism. Wherever two or more people come together, there is bound to be conflict. This workshop will give participants a six-step process that they can use and modify to resolve conflicts of any size.

Participants will also learn crucial conflict resolution skills, including dealing with anger and using the Agreement Frame. Key Learning Outcomes: - Transform conflict into opportunity - Develop constructive strategies for dealing with difficult behaviour - Develop communication skills to diffuse the situation - Increase confidence and assertiveness in dealing with difficult behaviour - Manage your emotions and deal with stress - Understand the power of words and how to use them to your advantage Workshop Overview: - What are the behaviours that we find difficult to deal with? - Develop an understanding of how flight or fight reactions prompt difficult behaviour - Controlling your reactions and choosing how you respond - Strategies for staying calm and keeping your cool when dealing with difficult behaviour - How attitudes play a part – What’s it like being on the receiving end of me? How do I come across? - Dealing with the situation/problem, not the individual - Dealing with anger, your own and others – Be able to use basic anger management techniques - Developing communication skills, such as the agreement frame, active listening and open questions - Applying techniques to deal with difficult behaviour - Understand what conflict and conflict resolution mean - Understand all six phases of the conflict resolution process -Understand the 5 main styles of conflict resolution and be able to adapt the process for all types of conflicts - Speak up assertively and confidently when dealing with difficult behaviour To book: email info@biztraines.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
Beginner's Weekend - Afternoon session, A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two afternoons, this is our most popular short workshop! Give yourself a gift of a new creative hobby (or maybe even a career?) this spring!

The students start with basic ring making in copper or brass. We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.

Students will learn how to measure their fingers to get an accurately sized ring, later they will also learn how to take sizing from existing rings. They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.

Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!

In the first session they are also shown how to texture metals, cut and layer shapes, melt balls of silver and other techniques to create decorative elements.

Students can spend their evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day. We encourage them to carefully plan this project and think about how they might make their piece before they begin, including creating drawings and notes. (We always say drawings don’t need to be “good”, they just need to make sense to the student and their tutor!). This project can be another ring, or earrings or pendants. We have a great selection of example pieces in the workshop so they can see what’s achievable in the 3-hour time frame. Sometimes students can make more than one silver piece if they have enough time.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and chains are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids 12 and up are welcome in this class, any person under 16 years old must be accompanied by an enrolled caregiver.

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Epigenetics Congress, Sciinov Group is elated to announce the Epigenetics Congress, scheduled as a hybrid event on October 23-24, 2025, in San Francisco, CA, USA.

The Epigenetics Congress 2025 is set to be a transformative international conference, bringing together a distinguished group of researchers, scientists, clinicians, and industry professionals to explore the rapidly evolving field of epigenetics and gene regulation. This prestigious event will serve as a collaborative platform for exchanging innovative ideas, discussing groundbreaking discoveries, and fostering interdisciplinary partnerships that drive scientific advancements and therapeutic innovations.

With a focus on cutting-edge research, emerging technologies, and translational applications, this congress will cover key topics related to epigenetic mechanisms, chromatin dynamics, DNA methylation, histone modifications, non-coding RNAs, and their implications in human health, aging, cancer, metabolic disorders, neurodegenerative diseases, and regenerative medicine. Attendees will gain insights into how epigenetic modifications influence gene expression and disease progression and explore novel therapeutic strategies, biomarker development, and precision medicine approaches based on epigenetic profiling.

Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Hormones, Hunger & Home Loans, Hormones, Hunger & Home Loans
Tired, craving, & overspending? You are not alone.

Join renowned nutritionist and wellness expert Lucy Edwards, along with special guest multi-award-winning mortgage adviser and financial educator Zebunisso Alimova.

Together the will guide you through this practical, eye-opening, and fun session.

They'll unpack the real reasons behind energy crashes, mood swings, and impulse spending—especially during high-stress times like buying a home, navigating a separation, or managing the chaos of family and work life.

We’ll cover:

-How your hormones (and blood sugar) affect your spending habits
-The link between stress, emotional eating, and financial decision-making
-Food swaps and simple nutrition hacks for better energy and mood stability
-Financial mindset tips to reduce panic spending and increase financial control
-Q&A time with both a Nutritionist and a Mortgage Adviser

This is not just another boring money talk... or another nutrition lecture. It’s real-life, relatable, and designed for women who are juggling a lot – and want practical tools to feel better, spend smarter, and thrive.

Who This Is For:
-First home buyers
-Busy mums
-Women navigating life changes (separation, career shifts, etc.)
-Anyone feeling financially or physically drained right now

Spots are limited – reserve yours today and take the first step toward balancing your hormones, hunger, and homeownership dreams!

This course is suitable for people who are new to leadership and would like the theory and practice that provides a foundation for a successful leadership career. It is also beneficial for those who have been in a new role for a while that requires some leadership expertise.

Understand the basic concepts of leadership

description:
Epigenetics Congress, Sciinov Group is elated to announce the Epigenetics Congress, scheduled as a hybrid event on October 23-24, 2025, in San Francisco, CA, USA.

The Epigenetics Congress 2025 is set to be a transformative international conference, bringing together a distinguished group of researchers, scientists, clinicians, and industry professionals to explore the rapidly evolving field of epigenetics and gene regulation. This prestigious event will serve as a collaborative platform for exchanging innovative ideas, discussing groundbreaking discoveries, and fostering interdisciplinary partnerships that drive scientific advancements and therapeutic innovations.

With a focus on cutting-edge research, emerging technologies, and translational applications, this congress will cover key topics related to epigenetic mechanisms, chromatin dynamics, DNA methylation, histone modifications, non-coding RNAs, and their implications in human health, aging, cancer, metabolic disorders, neurodegenerative diseases, and regenerative medicine. Attendees will gain insights into how epigenetic modifications influence gene expression and disease progression and explore novel therapeutic strategies, biomarker development, and precision medicine approaches based on epigenetic profiling.

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”
hi@lynofuro.co.nz |
www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
Leadership and Management Part 3, Leaders today are expected to be the driving force of their teams. They are constantly under pressure to lead effectively in a business environment that is characterised by constant change. Our leadership and management courses offer participants the opportunity to develop the necessary skills to embrace this challenge and lead their teams through these times with confidence and pride.

Our Leadership & Management - Part 3 workshop is a practical skills training course designed for people already in a leadership/management position, or those about to take up a new role, who want to explore the latest thinking and models for effective management and leadership and build on the techniques acquired in our Part 1 and 2 workshops.

In today’s world, emotional Intelligence is a critical and powerful component of effective leadership. This 2-day course will equip leaders with the skills to become more ‘people smart’ by developing ways to lead with emotional intelligence. Participants will also learn how to inspire their people with a shared vision and align teams to company goals, along with the tools to lead and manage change, ways to become a more influential and persuasive leader and the tools to raise awareness and manage unconscious bias in the workplace.

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.

description:
Resilient Waters: NZ–German Conference, Strengthening Urban Water Systems Against Extreme Weather – German Insights for Aotearoa

New Zealand’s water infrastructure is under growing pressure from climate change, ageing systems, and extreme weather events. Ensuring safe drinking water, reliable wastewater management, and resilient infrastructure requires fresh thinking and innovative solutions.
The Resilient Waters Conference, hosted by the German-New Zealand Chamber of Commerce (GNZCC), will bring together German innovators and New Zealand stakeholders for a high-level forum dedicated to future-proofing New Zealand’s water systems.
At this conference, a delegation of German companies will present cutting-edge technologies and intelligent system solutions designed to improve water resilience in the face of climate change. The programme will feature expert presentations, sector-specific insights, and networking opportunities with a professional audience from water utilities, engineering firms, city councils, and decision-making bodies.
Following the conference, the programme for the delegation will continue with B2B meetings, expert roundtables, and site visits in Wellington, Hawke’s Bay, and Auckland from 17–21 November 2025. These tailored sessions will connect German companies directly with New Zealand stakeholders to exchange knowledge, explore collaboration, and identify concrete opportunities for partnership.
 This initiative is organised by the German-New Zealand Chamber of Commerce (GNZCC) in collaboration with German partner AHP International and funded by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (BMWE).

description:
Leadership And Management Part 1, Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team. Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.

This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
 
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast, Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Kapiti Coast to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.


Contact Meredith Dyer for more information:
| 027 808 3947

description:
Conscious Dance with Janni, I am creating a space to freeform dance – or ‘conscious dance’, where you can nourish your mind, body and spirit through mindful movement.
I’m offering 10 spots (first in) for anyone to come along for free in return for giving some feedback and agreeing to being in some non-intrusive photos to help us plan future events. Details will be provided via email in the next few days.
In this practice, we open and close with gentle, easy movements. You then explore and find your dance flow as we progress into the peak and beyond. The whole experience is yours to create in whatever way, shape or form that feels best for you. It may be fast or slow, wild or contained or alone or with others. You will move and dance to a range of music and there will be minimal guidance from me, as the facilitator.
Dance helps to energise and invigorate us. It has incredible health benefits which will become evident as you get comfortable and curious, build confidence and open your heart and mind to possibility.
If I can't offer a spot on this occasion, I will let you know when our ongoing events commence.

What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements

Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz

description:
Nelson - Empower Her Networking - Powerful Email Marketing, NELSON - Moutere Hills Restaurant and Cellar Door
Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing
Hosted by: Bryony Richardson
This month, we’re diving into Powerful Email Marketing, because your inbox might be the most underestimated goldmine in your business. Whether you’re building community, driving sales, or nurturing long-term clients, email marketing allows you to connect on a deeper level (without having to battle the unpredictable social media algorithm).
In September, we’ll be sharing ideas, swapping tips, and uncovering what makes a newsletter not just opened but loved. From juicy subject lines to irresistible calls-to-action, get ready to rethink the power of your email list.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?
Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn?
As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.
Personal Branding Opportunities: Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert.

Join the Inner Circle now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.
Empower Her is a global female networking community, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences.
Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.

description:
Painless Presenting - Tuesday 18th November, Full day presentation skills workshop in Wellington. Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for?
You work in a technical field. You’re great at your job — but struggle to get your ideas across the business.
You often:
Dive into technical detail that loses or confuses your audience
Overload people with too much information, which makes it harder to get the results you need
Find it tough to explain complex areas of your role in a way others can easily understand
Spend hours planning presentations, yet still feel stiff and uncomfortable when delivering
Feel nervous when presenting, and wish you could speak with more ease and confidence
If this sounds like you, Painless Presenting will help you cut through complexity, present clearly, and build the confidence you know is vital for your career growth.
What you will learn:
A proven step by step process that will take the pain out of planning presentations and set the foundations for becoming a more engaging, natural and effective business presenter.

Participants are taught how to write a valuable business presentation, how to manage their nerves, design useful visuals and are given key delivery techniques to help deliver their presentations in a natural and engaging way.
You will come away with:
an understanding of how to use the SpeakerMap™ system, a step by step, proven approach to planning presentations quickly and effectively
a new appreciation of purpose when speaking
an understanding of how to quickly design useful presentation visuals
how to easily overcome the problems of speaking too fast, um-ing and ah-ing, and losing your place
a tailored strategy to dissolve the anxiety that so often accompanies presenting
three delivery tricks that will help you come across as credible and confident
Note: You will not need to present to the group on this course. If you are interested in a more intensive training option, including one on one coaching, check out our 2 day workshop The Effective Speaker.
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

description:
Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin, Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin
Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Tickets here!
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98187/Traskforce!-Ft.-Wallace-Gollan-And-Eugene-Wolfin.utr

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.


The performers:

Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.


Door sales $20, Pre-sales $15, Student/Concession $10


Personnel:

Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums
