description:
Nuclear Disarmament in a Nuclear Free New Zealand: Why it still matters, New Zealand is recognised as a global leader in nuclear disarmament, with its 1987 Nuclear
Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act becoming a defining feature of the country’s
national identity. The establishment of a nuclear free zone has served as inspiration
worldwide, yet, despite this, the nuclear issue remains relevant to New Zealand. As long as
nuclear weapons exist, their environmental, humanitarian and geopolitical impacts extend far
beyond the borders of nuclear weapon states.
This panel and fireside chat seeks to situate New Zealand’s position within the global
nuclear landscape, exploring why the issue continues to matter to a nuclear free country,
highlighting the interconnected impacts of these weapons, whilst also considering New
Zealand’s role as a disarmament leader.

description:
Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order, Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order
Associate Professor Christina Lai will speak on Taiwan's trade practices against the backdrop of Cross-Strait tensions

About this Event

Abstract
Over the last decade, China has punished countries that undermine its territorial claims and foreign policy goals with measures such as restricting trade, encouraging popular boycotts, and cutting off tourism. These coercive measures have caused significant economic damage to U.S. partners such as Japan, the Philippines, Taiwan, and Australia. This talk focuses on Taiwan’s response to China’s economic sanctions, highlighting the agency of medium-sized countries in the shadow of a great power.
The second part of this presentation will propose a common understanding of the liberal international order in which state and non-state actors follow rules, norms, and legal procedures in conducting international affairs. This rule-based practice is an essential part of the Asian regional order. If Taiwan were integrated into the multilateral institutions in Asia, the chance of conflict would be greatly reduced. The future of Taiwan also depends on the resilience of the liberal international order and other middle-power states in the Asia Pacific.


Bio
Christina Lai is an Associate Research Fellow in the Institute of Political Science at Academia Sinica, Taiwan. Dr. Lai received her Ph.D. in Government from Georgetown University. In 2015-2016, she was a post-doctoral fellow in China and the World Program at Princeton University. She is interested in U.S.-China-Taiwan Relations, Chinese Foreign Policy, East Asian politics, and Qualitative Research Methods. Her works have appeared in the Politics, International Politics, Political Science, PS: Political Science & Politics, Journal of Contemporary China, Pacific Review, and Asian Security.



Agenda


🕑: 04:30 PM - 05:30 PM
Welcome reception with refreshments and light catering

🕑: 05:30 PM - 06:30 PM
Keynote address: Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal Intern
Host: Christina Lai

description:
The Challenges of Peacebuilding, In this conversation, Dr David Harland will reflect on his experience working as a mediator and negotiator in conflict zones and his role as Director of the Geneva-based Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue. The Centre was awarded the Carnegie Wateler Peace Prize in 2022 “for its track record of finding the means, including mediation, to bring parties together and end conflicts”. Its work has included involvement in Aceh and Mindanao, assisting with the disbanding of the Basque separatist group ETA, and the Black Sea Grain Initiative. David will share insights on the challenges of peacebuilding in an era of growing competition and contestation.
Dr David Harland is a former New Zealand diplomat and Executive Director of the Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue (HD), a Geneva-based foundation that specialises in the mediation of armed conflict. He previously worked for the United Nations, including in Bosnia, Kosovo, Haiti and Timor Leste, and he wrote the UN Secretary-General’s landmark report on the fall of Srebrenica. David serves on the UN Secretary-General’s high-level advisory board on mediation. He has degrees from Harvard University, Tufts University, Beijing University and Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington.
The event will be followed by light refreshments.

description:
Padi Advanced Open Water Course, Exploration, excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water (AOW) Diver course is all about.

The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible. That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.

The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive. Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).

You may choose to add the 'Enriched Air' and/or the 'Dive Against Debris' specialty qualifications to your weekend experience. Simply ask to: include these dives as part of your five dives, complete the on-line study and a short practical, pay a small fee – and go diving. These Specialties count towards the prestigious PADI Master Scuba Diver rating.

Pay your deposit and you can begin the AOW theory. Make sure your dive medical is current, then join us for a weekend's fun diving. After everything is completed, you will qualify as a PADI AOW Diver. This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.
If you have any questions, please call so we can help you.

description:
FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK), We’re back for one last jam - and we’re going out with a bang! Join us for an extended party session at Parrotdog, with special guest DJ Audit from Auckland. The last time we teamed up at The Yotty (RIP) in Raglan, it was the stuff of legend. Let’s make it happen again - see you on the dancefloor!
FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format. The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.” Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon. Now based in Bali, FUNKIN’ DONUTS is going global - relaunching with a fresh, dancefloor-focused energy.
Joining us from Tāmaki Makaurau: DJ Audit
Since 1998, Audit has been crafting an eclectic sound that transcends genres while staying rooted in Hip Hop culture. A lifelong record collector and open-format DJ, his sets seamlessly weave Disco, Hip Hop, Soul, Cumbia, and Latin rhythms into vibrant journeys. With decades of experience, a deep appreciation for musical diversity, and an instinct for reading the crowd, Audit creates electric atmospheres that keep the audience moving.
Host with the most: Flex Webster
Flex Webster lives and breathes music. A DJ, producer, and record collector with a career spanning almost three decades, his journey has taken him around the globe. Flex’s sound blends Afrobeat, Latin, Funk, Hip Hop, Reggae, Disco, and House, reflecting the soulful rhythms of the African diaspora. Don’t miss this rare B2B with old mate Audit - your last chance to catch Flex for a while, as he returns to Bali to bring his magic back to the Island of the Gods.

description:
Wairarapa Youth Orchestra: Around The World With Music, Get ready for a global classical musical journey as the Wairarapa Youth Orchestra presents their special concert, “Around the World with Music”!
The vibrant sounds of violins, flutes, cellos, trombones, and more will fill the Wairarapa Events Centre, Carterton as our young musicians from across the Wairarapa share their hard work. These talented tamariki and rangatahi are now ready to take you on an unforgettable adventure through sound.

Under the expert guidance of conductor Andrew Atkins and our dedicated tutors, the Wairarapa Youth Orchestra has been diligently preparing a diverse program that celebrates music from various continents. Prepare to be captivated by everything from the rhythmic pulse of African drums to the sweeping melodies of European symphonies, including the grandeur and pomp of Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture, and evocative folk tunes echoing the sounds of Asia. It’s a unique opportunity to experience a rich tapestry of sounds, all brought to life by the passion and talent of our local youth.

This inspiring event is more than just a performance; it’s a vital fundraiser. The Wairarapa Youth Orchestra offers free orchestral music learning to young people throughout the Wairarapa, and we rely entirely on fundraising and donations to keep this invaluable program thriving. Your attendance directly supports the continued musical education of our community’s youth.

Two epic Wellington institutions – BATS Theatre and RadioActive.FM – are teaming up this Halloween to deliver an unforgettable night of music, energy, and community spirit, all while raising essential funds to keep these local legends alive.

Rave to the Grave – Fund-Raise the Dead for BATS Theatre and RadioActive.FM will transform the Kent Tce into a pumping, all-night celebration on Halloween night. With three unique dance spaces across all of BATS’ venues, ravers can choose their vibe, from blissed-out chill, to deep grooves, to high-energy bass.

TICKETS ARE STRICTLY LIMITED SO BE QUICK!

More than 30 RadioActive.FM DJs will be behind the decks, from all your favourite shows, including The Jewel School, Midnight Marauders, The Floor, Homebass, The Session, and more!
Following the resounding success of last year’s fundraiser, Flight of Fancy – BATS Turns 35, hailed as one of the city’s most exhilarating parties, the need for ongoing community support remains critical.

That event raised significant funds for the theatre, highlighting the essential role Wellingtonians play in sustaining the city’s arts and music scene.

Both BATS and RadioActive.FM, as charitable organisations, must continually raise funds to keep their doors open and their creative voices alive, ensuring that audiences can continue to enjoy bold, independent theatre and iconic local broadcasting.

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:

This film chronicles Jacinda Adern's tenure as Prime Minister and provides an insight into both the political and personal challenges Jacinda faced during those six years. The inclusion of considerable footage from Jacinda's partner Clarke Gayford provides a deeply personal view of life as the Prime Minister in very challenging times.
(Los Angeles Times review) 'Prime Minister' is not interested in wrangling, dealing and lawmaking, or even the nuts and bolts or her progressive views. .. But in the fleet, pacey manner of the editing, toggling between private and public moments with highlight-reel efficiency, the film is a stirring glimpse of top-down kindness as a winning leadership style.

description:
Government Digital Transformation in Latin America - what can we learn?, We are excited to announce the latest in our series of talks on Digital Transformation, in partnership with Silverstripe.
María Inés Baque will be joining us online from Argentina to share her expert insights and experiences on the key goals, capabilities, opportunities and challenges for government digital transformation - with a range of use cases from around Latin America.
María Inés Baque is Government Transformation Advisor for Latin America, Canada, and the Caribbean (LCC) at AWS. She served as secretary of digital government and technology innovation in Argentina from 2016 to 2019. She coordinated the Digital Agenda 2030 and led the transformational efforts in the areas of digital services, digital inclusion, open government, open data and new technologies adoption.
Global awards and recognitions she has received include Innovation Lab, Tel Aviv, 20 exceptional GovTech Leaders (2020), Women Corporate Directors 2019 and The 100 Most Influential People in Digital Government, Apolitical, 2018.
She was co-chair of the G20 Digital Economy Taskforce for Gender Inclusion in 2018 that issued the Bridging the Digital Gender Divide report.
Before government, her career was in global IT and financial services enterprises. She focused on process reengineering, startups, IT management, outsourcing and business process operations.
You may attend in person at the MBIE offices (limited to 40 people - there will be some food courtesy of Silverstripe), or you may tune in online via Microsoft Teams (the link will be at the bottom of your order confirmation email). If you choose to attend in person please arrive at 11.50am so there is time for you to sign in, pick up some food, and be seated before we begin. There will be time for questions after the presentation.

description:
Wellington Mayoral Debate 2025, There is no denying that public sentiment in Wellington has taken a beating. Dwindling economic stats, a struggling CBD and major infrastructure challenges have left the Wellington community feeling unhappy and unheard – and nobody has felt this more than the businesses in that community.
Every electoral cycle has debates, and all of them have politics. But this is the debate to attend if you are in business in Wellington, because unlike the others this debate is focused directly on what matters most to you.
What’s in-store
In partnership with The Post, BNZ & Victoria University of Wellington - Te Herenga Waka, the Wellington Chamber of Commerce is delivering the premier local government event for Wellington business: the 2025 Wellington Mayoral Debate.
Hear candidates Andrew Little, Ray Chung, Diane Calvert, Karl Tiefenbacher and Alex Baker talk about their vision for economic growth, their policy plans to stimulate business and their views on how council can work better with the private sector, all moderated by The Post’s own Andrea Vance.
Following the debate there will be the chance for open questions from the audience, providing you with the chance to hold candidates to account on the issues that matter most to you.
Light refreshments will be provided after the debate, where you’ll be able to network with candidates and business leaders.
Agenda:
5.30pm - Debate
6.30pm - Audience Q&A
7.00pm - Networking with drinks & nibbles
7.30pm - Event ends
Thank you to our media partner The Post , our venue partner, Victoria University of Wellington - Te Herenga Waka, and our supporting partner BNZ for their support.
label: Government & Politics

description:
A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson

description:
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course, Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
with Kadam Birgit

By keeping Atisha’s Advice in our heart, we can maintain a peaceful happy mind, our human nature and good qualities will improve, we will be able to show a good example for the people of our troubled world and we will quickly attain full enlightenment.

As Venerable Geshe-la says, ‘Simply putting this Advice into practice we will naturally become a Bodhisattva, a holy compassionate being who is the object of everybody’s love and respect’.

On this half day course Kadam Birgit will share teachings given at the International Summer Festival 2025 on Advice from Atisha’s Heart.

Although it was composed many centuries ago, this much-loved Buddhist scripture is full of practical advice to help us deal with the challenges of modern living, and transform our life into an authentic path of inner development.

Everyone welcome.

WHAT TO EXPECT
These classes are based on Buddha’s teachings on the mind, but you do not need to be a Buddhist to attend, or to benefit from them. There is no physical exercise involved and you can choose to sit either in a chair or on a cushion. These classes are suitable for all levels of experience.

Registration starts at 9:30am. This course includes a vegan, wheat-free morning tea (we cannot guarantee gluten-free).

description:
Pinhole Photography - Three Day Creative Arts holiday programme, Did you know that any object that can be made light tight can be turned into a camera? Come along to this three-day workshop and choose an object – it could be a tea pot, a book, a coffee jar – to turn into a pinhole camera to then create black and white photographs with.

We’ll work in the darkroom and explore the process of loading your camera with silver gelatin paper, before making exposures in the garden around the historic Inverlochy house, testing different angles and perspectives. We’ll then return to the darkroom to develop your photographic negative, and print it as a positive. You’ll leave the course with a series of atmospheric pinhole photographs, having experienced the magic of hands-on darkroom printing.

Bring a water bottle and morning tea. Recommended age for this course is tweens & teens ages 10 and above.

Monday - Wednesday, 22 - 24 September, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including pottery, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - September, Social Sewing Saturday - September
Join us for a fun day of sewing and socializing this September at Social Sewing Saturday - make new friends and create something amazing tog

About this Event

Social Sewing Saturday - September
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

description:
Randell Cottage Annual Open Day, Tour this small colonial Cottage and marvel that it once housed a couple and their ten children. Share afternoon tea and listen to authors reading their works.
Randell Cottage is a rare example of colonial domestic architecture and is a listed historic place. It retains most of its original 19th century configuration, although modified as a comfortable home for writers from NZ and France. It is only open to the public annually as part of the Festival. The event includes a series of readings from current and past residents.
A limited programme will be offered if weather conditions are poor.

Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/.../randell.../

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”
hi@lynofuro.co.nz |
www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
Mallrat | Wellington (SOLD OUT), Australian indie pop princess Mallrat will return to New Zealand this September on the Light Hit My Face Like a Straight Right World Tour, following a run of sold out shows across Europe and USA.
Sophomore album Light Hit My Face Like A Straight brings dance music that has heart and potent magic which will be manifested into life on stage, alongside all your favourite Mallrat hits and accompanied by her incredible live band.
The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.
Joining Mallrat on her New Zealand headline shows is none other than Aotearoa’s own indie pop darling, Riiki Reid — bringing her signature style and infectious energy to the stage for an unforgettable night of music.

Care Cafe - come for free coffee and warm chats this Mental Health Awareness Week!, Care Cafe - come for free coffee and warm chats this Mental Health Awareness Week!
Come along to 2/57 for a free barista-made coffee, and a casual chat with some friendly folks.

2/57 is a dynamic, values-based, human-centered co-working space in the city. twofiftyseven.co

CoLiberate is a social enterprise working to normalise and uplift everyday mental health support conversations in Aotearoa. coliberate.co.nz

Tuesday 7th October
10am-11.30am
Level 2, 57 Willis St (go down the arcade to the right of Unity Books, pass the sushi shop on your right, take the lifts up to level 2 then turn right to follow the sounds and smells of coffee!)

description:
‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW
‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email for more information and group bookings

Baby Sleep with Kate Anderson, Welcome to Baby Sleep with Kate Anderson at St Augustine's Church, Petone on September 11, 2025 at 10:00 AM!
Join us for an informative session led by Kate Anderson on your little ones sleep. Whether you're a new parent or just looking to learn more, this event is perfect for you!
Kate is a NZ Registered Nurse (NZRN), WellChild Nurse, International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC), Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapist and Massage Therapist and runs her business Evoke Health.
https://www.evokehealthnz.co.nz/
This session is aimed for parents with babies aged 0-12 months.

- How development can impact sleep

- Settling ideas

description:
Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 11 Nov 2025, Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 11 Nov 2025
Get great at having hard conversations with Kaila Colbin

About this Event

Has this ever happened to you?
You’re sitting in a meeting and there are 50 elephants in the room with you that nobody is mentioning, and you’re doing the strategic plan but everyone knows it’s never going to work because the team don’t have the capability or the capacity and that one person never follows through and that other person thinks her work is better than it is, but nobody says anything and as you leave you think well THAT'S three hours I’m never gonna get back…
It’s hard to say the hard thing.
But saying the hard thing is the only way we can deal with what’s actually going on.
The number one indicator of a lack of courage is an inability to have hard conversations.
Hard conversations are scary. Our hearts start pounding, our tummies clench, our mouths go dry.
Hard conversations feel dangerous. If I say this thing, he’ll be offended! She’ll be angry! I’ll get in trouble!
Hard conversations are tempting to avoid. Nobody else is mentioning these elephants. Why should I?
But what if you were great at them?
What would it mean for your relationships?
What would it mean for your career?
What would it mean for your life?
Kaila Colbin has worked with more than 4,000 people to grow courage as a core competency and a clear framework has emerged from that experience.
In this 1-day workshop, you’ll build the skill and muscle to get great at having hard conversations.
We’ll cover the specific elements of how to communicate and what to communicate.

When: Tuesday, 11 November 2025, 9 am-4:30 pm
Where: Rangimarie Room, Te Papa Museum, 55 Cable Street, Wellington 6011
Lunch, afternoon tea and all-day tea and coffee are included in the registration.



Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special rate of $745 + GST when you register (a $250 discount off our standard General Admission rates).



Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.



Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.


About the Kaila Colbin
Kaila Colbin is founder and CEO of Boma, an organisation building a world of intentional, intelligent, courageous leaders.
An award-winning leader renowned for impact, Kaila developed TEDxChristchurch into New Zealand’s flagship TEDx event and brought Singularity University to New Zealand and Australia, supporting thousands of people to engage with exponentially accelerating technologies and their impact on humanity. She trained with Dr Brené Brown as a Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator.
As a founder of the non-profit Ministry of Awesome, Kaila played a critical role in developing Christchurch’s startup ecosystem. She has extensive governance experience, and has been involved with mergers, capital raises, and company sales in the US and NZ.
A native New Yorker, Kaila’s work to champion Aotearoa New Zealand on a global stage saw her given the 2022 Kea World Class New Zealand “Friend of New Zealand” award. Her purpose in life is to be an uplifting presence.

If you have any questions about this event, please email us at .
label: Health & Wellness

description:
A Dialogue with a Movements Catalyst (Wellington), Discover What God Is Doing in Movements Around the World
Join us for an inspiring session with Ryan A., missionary, church planter, and movements catalyst.
For the past ten years, Ryan and his family have served among unreached peoples in South Asia and Southeast Asia. In 2017, Ryan helped catalyze a church-planting movement that has since multiplied into 10,000+ churches and 100,000+ baptisms—and continues to grow rapidly.
Today, Ryan serves as a mentor to movement leaders across Asia, helping ordinary believers multiply disciples and churches. His experience spans both the unreached world and the urban Western context, giving him a unique perspective that speaks powerfully into the New Zealand setting.
Why Attend?
Ryan’s message directly addresses two urgent needs in New Zealand today:
Reaching our lost communities with the good news of Jesus.
Revitalizing overseas missions sending, which has significantly declined in recent years.
If you long to see disciples and churches multiply—both here and to the ends of the earth—this workshop is for you.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Death Cafe Newtown, Death Cafe runs monthly on the 2nd Saturday.
Let's normalise our own demise! We are all going to die, let's talk about it. At a Death Café people - often strangers - gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Death Café is not a grief support group, or counselling session - instead it is a place to discuss death without expectations. The objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'.
For more information about Death Cafes generally, check deathcafe.com
For any pātai about this Death Cafe, email info@newtowncommunity.org.nz / call 04 389 4786

description:
Dying Matters Week, Dying Matters Week
Coming up at the Community Centre next month. 2 sessions totalling 1 hour in length.

Monday, 1st at 2:00pm Final Farewell: Your Legacy Your Way with Alina Reed
Ever wondered what your send-off might look like? A haka, a playlist, a tree planting? Join us for a 20-minute kōrero on the importance of documenting your funeral wishes — with heart, humour, and a dash of practicality. Let’s talk about how to make your final farewell truly yours.

Monday, 1st at 2:30pm Mary Potter Hospice with Imelda Coleman
You may know hospice through fundraising events like street appeals or strawberry fairs – but hospice is so much more than that. Join us for a short 20 minute session to learn about the holistic care Mary Potter Hospice provides, supporting not only patients but also their whānau. Discover how hospice care uplifts, comforts, and brings dignity at the most important time of life.

There is a link to the website here: https://gowithgrace.nz/dyingmatters/wellington-events/wellington-central/, you can pre-register here or come on the day.

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. The first Ecstatic Dance Wellington is here — come celebrate our launch at Vogelmorn with DJ Kimba Jade on the decks. 🌙❤️

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington – Launch Event ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to bring Ecstatic Dance Wellington to life! 🎉 This is the launch event, and we can’t wait to co-create the first of many transformational dance journeys with you.

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and leads Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

🎟 Tickets
$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington

$30 cash on the door

**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.

☀️ Extra Info
- Beanbags are provided for the end relaxation.
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to joining the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

❤️ What to Bring

Water bottle

Loose, comfy clothes

Warm layers for afterwards

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

No phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/

✨ Come help us launch Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau

Experience Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, a journey through the seasons inspired by the natural rhythms of Aotearoa. “Ngā Wā o te Tau” means “The Seasons,” and this sound bath, guided by Smita and Peter with the rich tones of taonga pūoro and waiata, invites reflection on the cycles of nature and our connection to the world around us.

This immersion takes you from winter’s stillness, through spring’s blossoms, summer’s warmth, and autumn’s release, attuning to the changing energies of each season. Unique sounds encourage reflection, connection, and inner calm, while gentle karakia and mindful intention weave the journey together, creating a meditative space to pause and breathe.

After the sound bath, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a wholesome way to close the evening in good company.

Meet your hosts & musicians, Smita & Peter, Smita (Ngāi Te Rangi) was born and raised in Aotearoa. From a young age she was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.

Peter is Pākehā, with grandparents from England and Ireland, and has been on a four-year journey learning the art of taonga pūoro — the traditional Māori musical instruments of Aotearoa. Guided by the wisdom and generosity of expert makers and players, he has learned both to craft and to play these unique instruments. For Peter, taonga pūoro offer a way to connect deeply with sound, story, and the natural world, and he is excited to share their voices as part of this sound bath experience.

What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang

Satay Seitan Skewer

Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce

Rice

Banana cake with caramel sauce

Hot "chocolate"
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: EUREKA @ MOON BAR, Eureka presents ‘GroundWerk’, a line-up built to shake the floorboards of Pōneke nightlife, stripping things back to pure energy and forward momentum. CEE begins the night with a deep hypnotic set with a steady pulse, setting the tone for the journey ahead. Doobie shifts gears with a high-pressure set full of movement and tension, pushing boundaries while keeping the floor locked in. Tunneling into late-night pressure with an unpredictable edge, Missthankyou flips the script with sharp, high-energy rhythms built to move bodies and twist minds in her signature style. Closing the night is Unwinworld, a chaotic duo known for blistering speed and raw intensity, engineered for total dancefloor eruption.

description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington
This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.

While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.

Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.

Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.

He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Embodied practices for ADHD, Embodied practices for ADHD
Discover how somatic practices and embodied awareness can offer meaningful support for living with ADHD.

Through somatic enquiry, you’ll be guided to develop a deeper understanding of your unique experience, and discover body-based practices that support living with more ease, alignment, and self-awareness.

Together, we’ll explore practices such as somatic enquiry, sensory and movement-based exploration, embodied mindfulness, and cultivating self-compassion. Along the way, we’ll engage with themes including motivation, emotional and nervous system regulation, sensory processing, overwhelm, and balancing rest with activity.

All are welcome — whether you are diagnosed, self-identified, or exploring the possibility.

Please feel free to reach out with any questions.

Ticket prices range from $50-$75, if finance is a barrier please reach out.

Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.

Her practice is influenced by Tantric Shaivism, contact improvisation, Open Floor dance, Hakomi somatic psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, Authentic Relating, and Nonviolent Communication.

description:
Embody Your Flow - Reconnect to the wisdom of your menstrual cycle, Embody Your Flow - Reconnect to the wisdom of your menstrual cycle
Explore how to recognise your body’s rhythms, needs and strengths throughout your menstrual cycle, and discover supportive practices grounded in somatic and embodied awareness.

Attuning to the wisdom of the menstrual cycle offers a meaningful way to honour your natural rhythms, nurturing ease, creativity, and deeper connection.

This course is trauma-informed and inclusive. No prior somatics experience is necessary, and all who menstruate are welcome.

Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.

Her practice is influenced by Tantric Shaivism, contact improvisation, Open Floor dance, Hakomi somatic psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, Authentic Relating, and Nonviolent Communication.

description:
Exploring our Shared Humanity, Do you ever feel that you're just going through the motions? That life is a series of tasks, a pursuit of pleasure, or a race for self-improvement that never really satisfies? This isn't just a feeling; it's a fundamental human question about what it means to exist.

Description
Join experienced psychotherapist Rohit Grover for a six-week course that invites you to look beyond the surface of everyday life. In these two-hour sessions, we will explore the core tenets of existential therapy, moving away from the conventional focus on self and hedonism. Instead, we'll grapple with life's big questions:

What does it truly mean to live a value-driven life?
Do our personal values matter, or is the search for meaning just an illusion?
What is the "being" part of "human being" all about?

Through guided discussions, reflective exercises, and insights from classic existential thinkers, Rohit will help you navigate this profound territory. This isn't about finding easy answers. It's about developing the courage to ask the right questions, to confront the realities of freedom, responsibility, and meaning, and to discover a more authentic way of living.

This course is for anyone ready to step off the treadmill and begin a deeper exploration of what it means to be alive. Come and find out what it means to truly exist

Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:

Differentiate between a life driven by external pressures or fleeting pleasures and one rooted in personal values and authentic meaning.

Identify and critically examine the core existential givens of human existence, such as freedom, responsibility, isolation, and the search for meaning.

Articulate a personal understanding of what it means to "be" a human being, moving beyond a purely functional or biological definition.

Arrive at sensing rather than thinking. Sensing this existence, this dance of life. Widen your view of existence.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour breathwork workshop for all wāhine.

Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are.

Shannon has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath.

In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.

What’s Included
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises.

What to Bring
Water bottle, a journal + pen and an eye mask. Mats, blankets & supportive props provided.

Who This is For
This workshop is open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$25***
Limited door sales for $30
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

description:
From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Wellington (FSB2025/01), From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan.
Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2025? How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.

IT'S TIME FOR A SERIOUS RETHINK IN HOW WE PREVENT MALE SUICIDE AND TO TAKE SUICIDE IN MEN OUT OF THE TOO HARD BASKET
Hear a comprehensive critique of why the suicide rate in men continues to rise despite numerous prevention initiatives, the reasons why we need to focus more on men and what are proven effective strategies for preventing male suicide.
BE PART OF THE SOLUTION
DURING THE MONTH OF MOVEMBER TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE  IN A WORKSHOP WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MALE SUICIDE PREVENTION SPECIALIST BARRY TAYLOR
It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.  Well men contribute to well whānau, communities, workplaces, economy and society
Drawing on his lived experience and his extensive experience in engaging, assessing and supporting suicidal men of different cultures, age groups, genders and sexualities, he offers practical and time proven approaches to both preventing male suicide, engaging with a suicidal man and effective initiatives to optimise men's wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"
Topics covered:
Overview of suicide in men
The Suicidal Moment - Men's thoughts, emotions and behaviour in the "suicidal moment”
Masculinity for the 21st Century - Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2024?  How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
Intergenerational suicide among men and its impact of whānau and hapū
From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.
Tāne Ora: An Online Masterclass in creating a movement of wellbeing for men by men
Participants would benefit from also registering for this online workshop series which takes a deep dive into the determinants of wellbeing men and what is required to shift very ingrained understandings in men about being a man.  How do we move from a program approach to mens wellbeing to a movement of change that engages men in conversations of the heart and the walrua. Click here for more information and to register
Previous participants’ feedback
"The best and most informative workshop I have attended in 27 years of mental health nursing”  Community Mental Health Nurse
"This workshop should be compulsory for anyone working with men”  Male Family Violence Worker
"It was as if Barry was talking about every young man I see at school”  School Counsellor
"I have much better understanding about depressed and suicidal men. Going away with lots of ideas of how work with the men in my community”  Rural Community Support Worker
"Thanks for being so inclusive of older men. They are so often forgotten”. Aged Care Worker
"The incorporation of Te Ao Māori into the training was excellent and made it relevant to the men I work with” Kaiwhakatere
"Most helpful workshop I have been to in regards to suicide”  Mental Health Recovery Programme Facilitator
"Appreciated how inclusive the presenter was of different cultures and his analysis of how culture influences what it means to be a man”  Refugee Health Worker
An opportunity for a day of learning with award winning suicidologist, Barry Taylor

Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention / postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.
His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to and evaluating  community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programmes.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in the context of suicide prevention and postvention both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas. In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award. He currently sits one of the Health and Disability Ethics Committees.
As a health sociologist, Barry offers an unique insight into the phenomenon of male suicide in the Aotearoa-New Zealand context, the role of gender construction and the critical social and cultural determinants that have influenced men's distress and impaired wellbeing. Insights that very few others trainers or training programs in this country provide. He has had an interest on the impact of social exclusion, alienation and discrimination on mens's wellbeing and advocates for a human rights based, systems change and person-centred approach to wellbeing.The workshop is enriched by the learnings from Barry's own lived experience of depression and suicidality and his pathway to recovery.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to effectively respond to the unacceptably high rate of male suicide in this country.

WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 30% discount off each registration
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay) 
Invoice - Organisations can request to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
Payment by Invoice is only for NGOs, Government Departments, Te Whatu Ora, PHOs, Schools and tertiary organisations, businesses.
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $45+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.
Organiser Contact Details
Barry Taylor
Principal Consultant |  TaylorMade Training and Consulting

Email:  registration@4wellbeing.nz   Website:  www.4wellbeing.nz

description:
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience
Stress and struggle leave their mark on both body and mind, sometimes in ways we can’t easily undo. Just as knots form in the body, impressions and tensions accumulate in the mind. While we can’t change the past, the Bhagavad-gita teaches that we can shape our future—what we choose to cultivate now carries us forward.
In this one-hour workshop, we’ll explore how philosophical and spiritual wisdom can help us rise above the tangles of trauma and anxiety. Through practical insights, open discussion, and guidance from the Gita’s philosophy, we’ll look at how to build resilience—not only by steadying the nervous system, but by exploring the deeper self beyond the changing body and mind.
Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 28th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Wellington, We're pleased to invite you to join us for this workshop on Building resilience and unlocking the power of the mind.
Why this matters:
In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill. It's not just about bouncing back from adversity but confidently navigating change. Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability. This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind. By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
What to expect:
During this interactive workshop, participants will explore the core concepts of resilience and the mind-body connection through engaging discussions, experiential exercises, and practical demonstrations. They will learn evidence-based techniques to enhance their resilience, manage stress effectively, and cultivate a positive mindset amidst adversity. By the end of the session, attendees will emerge with a comprehensive toolkit to fortify their mental resilience and embrace change with confidence.
Who this is for:
This workshop caters to individuals across all organisational levels who are eager to enhance their resilience and cultivate a resilient mindset. Whether you're an owner, manager, chef, senior staff member, or junior employee, this workshop offers invaluable insights and practical strategies to bolster resilience and thrive in today's fast-paced world.
About the presenter, Sarah Robb
Sarah is a certified coach, counselor, and Master Practitioner of NLP (neuro-linguistic programming) holding a Bachelor's degree in Psychology.
With a passion for transformation, she guides individuals through retraining their brains and breaking free from limiting beliefs and patterns. Drawing on her extensive lived experience, Sarah has collaborated with over 200 clients and organisations, empowering them to apply practical tools and strategies for significant improvements in their mental health.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time, Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

Celia Wade-Brown walked Te Araroa in 2017, and will be leading the Wairarapa Walking Festival two-day tramp from Waiohine to Holdsworth on 21st - 22nd November 2025. Celia will bring her overnight backpack and show the gear she is taking on the tramp.

The talk will cover: food and drink, hut wear, toileting tips, keeping your sleeping bag dry, emergency communications, and looking after your feet.

Bring your questions!
Adam Philps from Masterton Foot Clinic, a festival sponsor will be joining us to talk feet and things to consider.

Murray Johnston, chair of Wairarapa Land Search and Rescue will also be speaking. Please bring a gold coin to donate to WaiLandSAR.

description:
Draw It Out - Adult workshop, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.

Theme: Welcoming new possibilities
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

This single workshop focuses on the theme of welcoming new possibilities, great if you are going through change, wanting to transition or entering a new phase.

Date
This is a single workshop
6.15pm-7.30pm
Monday 29 September

Cost
$46 total

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.

This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”

For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.

Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
