description:
Northern Suburbs Big Spring Clean!, Hurray, it's nearly spring! Whether you're 8 or 80 come along and show your love for our neighbourhood and come along to this year's Community Spring Clean. This year we're going for Saturday 20th September, which also happens to be UN Community Clean Up Day.
Meet at Pukehuia Park at 10.30am to collect protective gear and rubbish bags, and then head out around our neighbourhood to collect what you can. You might like to head to somewhere you know is particularly rubbish-y around our suburb.
Bring your rubbish back to the park for a weigh-in and to be collected by the Council. Then celebrate your hard work and grab a free sausage or two off the BBQ.
Bring your friends and neighbours and join the fun and satisfaction of making our home a nicer place.
Organised by Newlands Anglican and Newlands Baptist Churches. For more info contact office@newlandsanglican.org.nz or get in touch with Rebecca on 021 0869 9235.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
COME AND SEE - Vocations Morning, Come and See is an opportunity to spend a morning with other like-minded young men, meet some priests and seminarians, and ask questions about the vocation to the priesthood.
Join us for Mass at 9:30am, followed by morning tea and a time of fellowship and discussion.
For catering purposes, please let us know you're coming. Contact l.hensel@wn.catholic.org.nz / text 021 164 5800
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Hurdle Film Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about Hurdle, screening on the 28th of August can be found at https://www.hurdlefilm.com/.
label: Film & Media

description:
Crochet - Christmas Special!, In this half day crochet special, you will get the patterns to make stars, and icicles, mini wreaths, a mini Christmas jumper, Christmas tree and gifts bunting and a cute mini Christmas hat. Please bring some 4 or 8 ply smooth yarn and a crochet hook - see full description for suitable types of yarn.

Description

Join Monique in this half-day crochet workshop where you will learn how to crochet a range of little projects suitable for the holiday season. Choose from stars, icicles, mini wreaths and Christmas jumpers, Christmas trees and a mini Santa hat! There will be a booklet of patterns for you to take home, to enable you to complete in your own time the projects that you didn’t have time to make during the workshop.

You will also learn how to crochet and decorate Christmas baubles! While you might not finish all the patterns this day, the aim is to have a go at making as many as possible!

You will need to know some basic crochet stitches such as single and double crochet. You’ll also need to have some understanding of how to read a pattern and work with diagrams, as taught in the beginners’ crochet course.

Please bring yarn that you enjoy working with (cotton, acrylic or wool, 4ply or 8 ply) in a variety of colours (red, white and green, a neutral colour for the mouse, and glittery yarns are all good options for the Christmas projects) and a matching crochet hook. You’ll also need a pair of scissors and a darning needle.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
The Lunch Society: Spring Edition, Join us for 'The Lunch Society: Spring Edition' , an afternoon of delicious food, meaningful connections, and inspiring conversations to warm the soul.

The Lunch Society is a quarterly ladies’ lunch event designed to bring together women in Wellington for networking, entertainment, and philanthropy.

This event is all about bringing together like-minded individuals to connect, learn, and share in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. Expect an engaging guest speaker, valuable networking opportunities, and plenty of moments to inspire you.

Settle in for a beautifully curated experience featuring:

• A powerful keynote by Kristy Grant on New Voices, Fresh Stories: Women Leading Creative Change
• A delicious three-course set menu and a refreshing welcome drink on arrival
• An exclusive goodie bag for every guest + spot prizes
• A chance to give back, with a portion of all ticket sales donated to a charity : KidsCan + Cancer Society

Whether you're a returning guest or joining us for the first time, you’ll be welcomed into a warm, inclusive space that celebrates women, ambition, and community. Come to be inspired, stay to be part of something bigger.

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Friday Night Mahjong (Aug 2025), Fancy joining our Friday evening session of Mahjong? Come along to enjoy some friendly games. We offer a variety of Mahjong styles to suit your preference, including Cantonese, Sichuan, and Taiwanese.
We are happy to answer the occasional question during the session, but we will not be running any lessons.
Note: minimum of 8 people to proceed.

Fee: $10 per person
Supper: Tea, coffee and light snacks provided.
Game sets: Please bring along your Mahjong sets.
Payment options: Credit card with 60c booking fee; Internet Banking or Cash
Venue info:
Accessibility: There is an outdoor ramp access into the building for less mobile people. 
Parking: Limited off-street parking is available beneath the building.

description:
DRNZ 2025 Waikawa Beach (Kapiti Coast), DRNZ 2025 Waikawa Beach (Kapiti Coast)
Waikawa Beach Ride – Saturday, 20 September 2025 🐴🌊

Come and join us at the beautiful Waikawa Beach on the Kāpiti Coast. With the tide out and the sand firm, the course will be perfect for you and your horse.

This is a special ride, hosted by Braden and Kezna Cameron (founders of DRNZ), and well worth the trip for the venue, the track, and the great company. A true DRNZ experience!

📍 Location: 85 Reay Mackay Grove, Waikawa Beach 5573
📅 Date: Saturday, 20 September 2025
🏇 Classes: 7, 15, 25, and 40km

Event details:
All information including base, track, camping, classes, payments and fees can be found here:
👉 Event Flyer: http://www.distanceridingnewzealand.co.nz/events-1/event-flyers-1#

Entries Online:
Enter here: https://web.drnz.mithyalabs.com/

✅ Entries close Friday, 12 September 2025. No late entries can be accepted.

More info about DRNZ, including membership, events, entries, results, and resources:
🌐 www.distanceridingnewzealand.co.nz

We look forward to seeing you there!

description:
Toi Art Saturdays: Guided Slow Looking (FREE), Take a closer look. Join free, student-led sessions that invite slow looking, reflection, and thoughtful conversation around art.
Going to a gallery can sometimes feel a bit overwhelming with so much to see – on average, people spend less than 30 seconds viewing a work of art!
At these relaxed sessions, local high school students will guide you in slow looking. This is an approach gaining traction around the world that invites us to linger and look closely, letting our responses unfold. You’ll make your own discoveries and create your own meanings, with some discussion and fun along the way.
Each session will begin by looking at Traffic Cop Bay by Bill Hammond, followed by another surprise artwork. No two sessions will be the same!
No booking required. Meet at the session start time on level 5 in the Toi Art galleries – we'll be waiting in the reading space at the top of the main stairs.
SESSION TIMES
- 10.00–11.00am
- 11.00am–12.00pm
- 12.00–1.00pm
- 1.00–2.00pm
- 2.00–3.00pm

description:
Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Double the nights, double the chaos. Dance, crawl & party across Wellington Halloween weekend. DJs, shots & finales ‘til 2AM!

About this Event


Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎧
Halloween weekend is built for the bold — and this pass is your all-access ticket.
The Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass gets you into both nights of the city’s most electrifying Halloween parties. Friday kicks off with Fright Night, a citywide takeover where DJs, costumes, and neon lights set the stage. Saturday keeps the momentum alive with Screams & Shots, a high-voltage crawl of bars and clubs serving Halloween-themed shooters and nonstop beats.
This isn’t just a bar crawl — it’s a two-night music-fueled Halloween marathon. Think of it as your festival pass to the city’s nightlife: two different lineups, two massive finales, one unforgettable weekend.




WHY GRAB THE WEEKEND PASS?
⚡ Two Nights, One Wristband – Access to both Friday & Saturday events.
🎶 Festival-Level Energy – Back-to-back parties with DJs mixing EDM, hip hop, and Halloween remixes.
🍹 Exclusive Drink Deals – Spooky cocktails, shot specials, and themed drinks both nights.
🎭 Costumes Required – From glow-in-the-dark ghouls to full-on festival fits, the dance floor is your stage.
📍 Multiple Venues – 4+ stops each night, all within walking distance, ending in a huge late-night finale.


HALLOWEEN CRAWL INSTRUCTIONS
Check-In: Get your weekend wristband at the starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM each night).
Crawl the Clubs: Move between participating venues at your own pace from 8:30–11:30 PM.
Finale Blowout: Meet the full crowd at the closing party from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


YOUR WEEKEND PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Entry to both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venue
📱 Access to the official crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live entertainment at every stop
🍸 Drink + shot specials exclusive to crawl attendees
🕺 Two grand finale parties — one each night




PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.

👻 Whether you’re chasing bass drops, showing off your costume on packed dance floors, or rallying your crew for back-to-back nights out, the Weekend Pass is your way to experience Halloween without limits.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Grab yours now before they sell out.



18 + EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 2, For those who have completed Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1 recently or have equivalent knowledge. [Please see the Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1 course description for an indication of what is covered]. Course fees: If you are a NZ citizen or hold a NZ Resident/Permanent Resident Visa the course fee is $99 (evidence of eligibility required). If you are here on a Work Visa/Working Holiday Visa the course fee is $189.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Discuss our responsibilities as a bi-cultural nation under ‘Te Tiriti o Waitangi’ and identify underlying Māori values such as: whanaungatanga, pepehā and tikanga
- Discuss the significance of whakapapa as a fundamental Māori world view and confidently describe your family and relationships through this lens
- Form simple sentences to describe parts of your face and body
- Discuss protocol on the marae
- Recognise the importance and use of karakia and be able to recite one correctly
- Recognise the cultural values inherent within different whakataukī (proverbs) and kīwaha (idioms) and be able to correctly recite one of each

Prerequisites
For those who have completed an Introductory 1 course, or equivalent. Note: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and for statistical purposes, some additional information is required as part of the enrolment process.


A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

description:
NZ Mountain Film Festival 2025 - Awards Night, A collection of New Zealand-made mountain films - brought to you by the Vic Uni Tramping Club, Wellington Tramping and Mountaineering Club, and of course the New Zealand Mountain Film and Book Festival!

Awards Night: Thursday 25 Sep (doors open at 6:00pm, films start at 6:30pm):

- Footprints on Katmai (22 mins) Max Romey, USA. Following his grandmother's footsteps to one
of the most remote and bear-strewn beaches in Alaska, painter Max Romey discovers that an
ocean of problems is closer to home than he could have imagined. BEST FILM ON THE ENVIRONMENT
- Alone Across Gola (20 mins) Jude Kriwald, UK, NZ Premiere. Stranded in Liberia’s Gola
rainforest, filmmaker Jude Kriwald faces hunger, isolation, robbery and disappearing trails. A raw
tale of one man’s solo, self-filmed journey chasing a childhood dream. With only a bike and a
tent, Jude pushes the limits of survival and self-discovery. BEST ADVENTUROUS SPORTS & LIFESTYLES
- Zahir (36 mins) Julien Nadiras, Switzerland, subtitles. Katherine and Eline take on an iconic rock
route, accessing it by bike. Their all-eco ascent tests endurance, nerve, and friendship, with long
runouts and tiny holds pushing them to the edge.
- Body of a Line (10 mins) Henna Taylor, subtitles, USA. A cleverly animated short film that
morphs into real life as Madaleine undertakes an intimate and creative journey to climb a difficult
rock route, with original music and poetry. BEST SHORT FILM
- Trango (46 mins) Leo Hoorn, USA. After a two-year attempt, ski mountaineers ski the first
descent of the Great Trango Glacier. They navigate risk, grapple with grief, and face physical
danger as they push the limits of human experience. Unspoken trust and support within their
expedition team allows them to face the unimaginable together. GRAND PRIZE FILM

Total running time: 120 minutes + 15 minute intermission.

description:
Magic: Commander Party Edge of Eternities @ Ceberus Games, Join us for Commander Party! Purchase a booster for entry.
Commander Party is a story-inspired Commander event that immerses players in the setting of the latest set release. The vibe is fun and casual, and the events are outstanding opportunities to welcome in broad groups from your community, from new players to lore enthusiasts to Commander fans.
The event features special rules designed specifically for Edge of Eternities and includes play aids and party cards to support play.
Set up and play follows the regular Commander format rules but players all have these additional abilities:
Special Rules:
Alternate win condition: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control all five worlds, you win the game.
At the beginning of your end step, if one or more opponents lost 3 or more life this turn, gain control of an unclaimed world or a world controlled by one of those opponents.
Whenever you cast your commander, you get an orbit counter.
, pay an orbit counter: choose left or right. Each player passes control of a world they control to the next player in the chosen direction. Activate only as a sorcery.
Each world card also grants a triggered ability whenever a player gains control of it and at the beginning of their upkeep while it is in their control in their command zone.

description:
XTrail Spring - Battle at Boulder Hill, XTrail Spring - Battle at Boulder Hill
Boulder Hill offers up a classic slice of Wellington trail running - rugged, scenic, and deeply rewarding. Set in the Belmont Regional Park, the three courses take you through a mix of lush native bush, open ridgelines, and rolling farmland with epic views across the Wellington harbour, Hutt Valley, and out to the coast. The short course is a compact loop with punchy climbs and flowing descents, while the long course gives you the full Boulder Hill experience — a steady climb from the valley floor to the summit, followed by sweeping downhills and one final sting in the tail before you loop back to base. A true taste of the terrain that makes this region so special.

https://barefootxtrail.co.nz/

description:
Aroha Quartet and Friends, The popular Wellington-based Aroha String Quartet (violinists Haihong LIu and Konstanze Artmann. violist Zongxian Jin and cellist Robert Ibell) will be joined by four colleagues from the NZSO and Orchestra Wellington to present a rare performance of Schubert's famous Octet for Wind and Strings. This very substantial work of just under an hour's length has six movements, all of them brimming with warmth, charm and glorious melody. There is a wide variety of tonal colour as each of the instruments in turn shares the limelight, with delightful solo lines from violins, viola, cello, clarinet, bassoon, horn and double-bass. The clarinetist will be Nick Walshe, Justin Sun the bassoonist, joined by Alexander Hambleton (horn) and Oleksandr Gunchenko (double-bass).

Also on the programme will be a string quartet by Mozart (No 22 in B flat, K589) and a humorous light-hearted piece by Danish composer Carl Nielsen called "Serenata in Vano" in which a group of musicians attempt. unsuccessfully, to attract the attention of a young woman.

Door sales will be available for this concert, or tickets can be bought from Waikanae New World or Moby Dickens Books in Paraparaumu Beach. For booking enquiries go to www.waikanaemusic.org.nz or phone 021 147 4859.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
NZIFF: Dreams (Sex Love), A teenage girl recounts her crush for her teacher through the pages of a memoir. The winner of the Golden Bear 2025 is a lucid and tender chronicle of the unforgettable experience of first love.

Originally intended as the second chapter in his trilogy and released in Norway as such, Dag Johan Haugerud’s Dreams ended up premiering internationally as the last. But it secured a fitting crown to the trilogy, by winning the Best Film at the 2025 Berlinale, thus inducting Haugerud among world class auteurs.

Dreams emanates from two of Haugerud’s passions: literature, as he first gained prominence in his homeland as writer, and the cinema of French master Éric Rohmer, distinguished by sentimental skirmishes brimful of finely written dialogues.

The film’s protagonist and narrator is Johanne, a 17-year-old student who falls for her new French teacher Johanna. Johanne manages to get close to her crush, who nonchalantly ignores how her student’s devotion is veering into affection. Yet, this chronicle of first love is told in a voice over reflecting the memoir that Johanne wrote on her experience – meaning that things may or may not have happened as she says. The memoir is also read by the girl’s mother and grandmother who muse on the girl’s literary talent and provide a layer of irony and melancholy to an unfathomably lucid and tender chronicle of the universal and unforgettable experience of first love. — Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

This meeting will incorporate AGM’s for four entities Hataitai Childcare Collective & Community House, Hataitai Bowling Club, Hataitai Community Recreation Trustee Ltd and the Hataitai Community Recreation Trust.
The meeting will provide an overview of the previous 12 months and our plans for the future, including an update on the redevelopment plans for the Bowling Club.
A relaxed and friendly event, all welcome!

21:00 Finish

With a range of games including Dungeons & Dragons, Savage Worlds, Pirate Borg, Paranoia, homegrown games, playtests, and more, there's sure to be something for everyone.

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
NZBW After 5 Wellington 15.10.25, Let’s Party !!
BA5 Wednesday 15th October from 5.30pm for a 6pm start
Chamber of Commerce Level 3 / 15 Daly Street Lower Hutt
Come along and receive a complimentary Mocktail and Nibbles on arrival.
The evening includes how to
Make a fabulous Mocktail (the one your drinking)
Make your table and your home stylish for a party OR Christmas Party
Make great your home storage with an amazing range of homewares.
Your lovely hosts are
Andrea from Botanical Homeware
Carol from Foxy Teas
Lyndal from Little Lace Flower Company
 From Andrea
Discover fun and creative ways to use our decorative tins – from stylish storage solutions to thoughtful, unique gifting ideas. I’ll show you how these beautiful tins can be repurposed for every occasion, turning a simple container into a memorable gift or a charming piece for the home. I’ll offer 10% off for purchases made on the night and I’ll also have a raffle basket of tins. So, every purchase gets a raffle ticket.
From Carol 
Join Carol from Foxy Tea as she shares creative ways to enjoy herbal and fruit teas. Discover how to turn them into refreshing mocktails and explore simple, delicious ideas for using them in your cooking. I’ll offer a 15% discount for purchases on the night.
From Lyndal
In my presentation, I will show how you can create a range of stunning looks for your dinner table that won’t break the bank or involve hours of work. As I demonstrate how to put together each look, I will discuss some general planning and design ‘rules’ that make styling your table a breeze. Throughout the demonstration, I will use décor items that are available to hire from my hire stock - an easy, great value and eco-friendly option for decorating. For everyone attending the presentation, these items will be available for hire at a 30% discount (subject to availability). One lucky person will also win an $80 voucher to spend on décor hire for their next party or event.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Mostly Music Soundscape Series | The Weather Machine, Mostly Music Soundscape Series | The Weather Machine
The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.



About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors at 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission. As a season pass holder you will be reserved seats near the front of the audience.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

With thanks to support from Creative NZ's Creative Communities Fund administered by Kāpiti Coast District Council.

description:
Greytown Art Town - Art Festival, Greytown Art Town - Art Festival
Greytown Art Town: 26th - 28th September 2025 - put it in the diary folks!

Greytown and its surrounding areas are home to an extraordinary concentration of diverse creative talent, producing a unique and vibrant range of artistic expressions. What better way to showcase this than with a local celebration of the arts?

Introducing Greytown Art Town—a dynamic festival dedicated to visual arts, music, poetry, and performing arts. This three-day celebration will offer a rich program of events for all ages and tastes. Included is the Wairarapa Art Trail, where visitors can explore over 30 open artist studios, experiencing artistic expression first hand.

For full program of events see our website:
www.greytownarttown.com

Join us as we Celebrate Creativity!

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Magical Dragonflies, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club, Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

description:
Labour day Breaker bay Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (set up at 1:00pm, pack-down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where you'll learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30-year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. whichever you choose instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment. It's important that the app/programme is installed on the student's device before the course begins, and that they have had a play on it to get used to how it works. This is so that the student is at least a little familiar with their chosen software so that it's enough to begin learning animation techniques on day one. Additional information found at our website.

Ross will advise you on a variety of animation apps/programmes available online to use, ranging in price from free to not very much. Note - A computer mouse can be used for 2D animation, but digital pens are much easier to use. Prior to the course commencing, you'll receive details of recommended programmes to use for the course.

Suitable for a range of ages, from teens to adults.

Tuesday evenings, 14 October - 2 December, 6:30-8:30 pm
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Sunday Jazz - Honey Boulton, The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

This week featuring Honey Boulton back briefly from his overseas adventures!

Better late than never! After some years exploring the global jazz scene Honey Boulton brings the release party of his most recent album home to Pōneke, at the Rogue & Vagabond.

The album/set is comprised of all original material from bebop to biguine to ballads. The compositions are inspired by Honey's primary influences (Toshiko Akiyoshi, Wes Montgomery, Charlie Parker etc.), as well as his friends, family and experiences solidifying his place in the London jazz scene.

Music from 5pm, FREE ENTRY - Koha for the band encouraged
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Planetary Parade - Free event, Six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Plimmerton Rotary Garden Tour 2025, Join us for a Springtime treat- a tour of ten gardens around the Pauatahanui Harbour.

The gardens are varied, from bijou suburban hideaways to a lifestyle block, and from an 1860s cottage garden to a modern design gem. They are testaments to the care and creativity of their owners.

Included is the iconic Heritage Rose Garden beside St Alban’s church in Pauatahanui, which features legacy and modern rose varieties around the burial ground.

Gardeners will be inspired by the experience - it will be an unforgettable day out.

Times - Gardens are open from 9.30 am to 4.30 pm on both days, except for the Pauatahanui Rose Garden/Burial Ground, which will be closed on Sunday morning until 1 pm.

Garden competition – A prize voted for by entrants for the “Best Garden” for Consultancy Services has been offered by Distinctive Home and Landscapes Limited to the value of $600. Other spot prizes will be drawn at the end of each day for entrants.

Ticket holders:


Note that when ticketing, select the Zone to start at: Camborne, Paremata/Aotea, Whitby, or Pauatahanui.

Preplan your garden tour from the map provided when tickets are issued, and have the plan available on the day.

Note that every effort is made to ensure gardens are as safe as practicable. All gardens are entered at visitors’ risk.

must obtain the garden owner's consent if you wish to take cuttings.

Note that the event will occur wet or fine, pets are not allowed, and no ticket refunds will be available.


This is a Plimmerton Rotary fundraiser for community benefit, and net proceeds will be shared by:


Gillies McIndoe Foundation, founded by Dr Swee Tan, benefits research work in developing accessible life-changing treatment options for brain cancer, vascular birthmarks and keloid scars through the use of affordable repurposed medications. https://www.gmri.org.nz/

“HAROLD” - North Wellington Life Education Trust - visits primary schools with an intriguing mobile classroom, furthering the Education of unique Life Skills for primary school children in the Porirua Johnsonville regions. northwellington@lifeed.org.nz


A special thanks to Titahi Bay Horticultural Society for their early support.

description:
Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games, Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games
Pokémon TCG League Cup tournaments give players an opportunity to earn Championship Points and practice their skills for larger competitions.

Here are the details:

Entry Fee: $25.00
Format: Standard
Tournament Structure: 3-5 Rounds Swiss followed by a Top 4/8 Cut Single Elimination

Decklists will be required. You may fill out a deck registration form on paper or submit one digitally to:


Each participant will receive a booster pack and a Pokemon Prize Packs on entry. A booster pack will be added to the Top Placers Prize Pool per participant.

description:
Vault: A Party for Men, THE VAULT: A sweaty sanctuary for men who desire men. Hard beats by WinnerMick and other DJs to be announced.
New trial venue! Cavern Club (tix are limited so get on it)
Presented by D'Bear Productions.
Attire suggestions: Leather / Harness / Jockstrap / Sports gear / Bare chest / Whatever. Secure check for your street clothes provided.
Welcoming men of all ages (21+) and body types.
House rules: Mutual respect required, boundaries honored. Transphobia will get you booted, and not in a fun way. 
This is a dedicated male environment - proudly including our trans-masculine, bisexual, pansexual, and queer brothers.
Come down to where you belong.

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pebble - Love In Every City, Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.
Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!

description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39), Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39)

Single? We have got you!



Highlights:

This unique event adds a playful twist to speed dating, allowing singles to connect through fun and games.
Enjoy simple board games like Giant Jenga, perfect for breaking the ice – even if you’re new to games!
Skip the awkward small talk and see how people interact in a relaxed, group setting. Match with someone and get connected for a second date.


You’ll start the night in mixed-gender groups and rotate around to see people of the opposite gender.



Feeling a bit shy? You’ll stay with your same-gendered group through the night, so bring a friend along for the ride!



Drinks are provided, and we have nibbles to keep you fueled. Because, let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!





After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15 and play other games.

A match form will be sent out the following day, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.





Recommended age 25-39.

Book now!



Not your vibe? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.

description:
September Shuffleboard Pairs Tournament, Come along to our monthly shuffleboard league!
Register here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shuffleboard
Shuffleboard pairs tournaments are 6pm to 9.30pm at the latest (usually earlier), the last Wednesday of each month.
Check out the league over at Challonge.com
https://challonge.com/communities/meanshuffle
Tournament Rules:
This is a double elimination format tournament. Teams must lose twice to be eliminated. Matches are played according to standard shuffleboard rules as can be read here:
https://www.theshufflehouse.com/.../how-to-play...
EXCEPT:
- There is a 10 MINUTE time limit each match.
- Matches are played FIRST TO TEN.
- In the event of a draw after the 10 minute time limit, a "Golden End" will be played. The winner of the Golden End wins the match.
- Pucks that do not pass the foul line are removed from play.
- The shuffleboard will be reset and resanded after each match.
- No sand will be added during a match.
- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon

New members welcome.

Feel free to come partway through the time or leave early as needed.
Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.
Usually gathered around one of the tables in the lounge area upstairs. Often near the walls for the brighter lights to better see our stitches.
There is a lift as well as stairs and Courtenay place bus stops across the road.
Held on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month with a summer break.

description:
Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Disclaimer: Photo not taken at The Pines, but captures the essence of what we expect to the night to be like.. full of laughter.. and lots of loudness..
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.

description:
Stitch a Still Life, Create your own A4 size Still Life with a vase or a bowl containing three dimensional flowers, fruit and /or leaves.
Linen fabric will be available in a range of colours for you to create your own background textured with simple stitches.
A bowl or vase for your flowers and fruit will be appliqued.
Some threads and fabrics will be provided but if you have something special you would like to incorporate into the Still Life you are welcome to bring it along and we can discuss how to best use it. For example, the bowl for the cherries is from an old, embroidered doily and the cherries are red velvet. A piece of lace may look good on the table.
You may not finish completely, but you will have been taught and practised each step.
Advice and options for finishing your piece of work for display will be given.

description:
Jewellery Making - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens, Craft your own rings in this introduction to metal-smithed jewellery making! In this quick paced one session workshop you’ll learn some metalworking fundamentals to turn raw silver, copper and brass into shining wearable rings. Use hammers and stamps to add textures and simple lettering to customise your creation!

Techniques covered:

- Use sizers and jeweller’s callipers to measure ring size
- Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces
- Use hammers and stamps to texture and form metal
- Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal
- Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery

Minimum age is 13 years. This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, pottery, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Made to bloom, exhibition by Josefine Gronkrans, We have a solo exhibition coming up from one of our ceramic artists Josefine Gronkrans
The opening night is 14th October, Tuesday at 5:30 pm
Vincents gallery : Willis St Village
5/148 Willis St
Wellington
14th October - 4th November
Pencil the date.
Nau mai haere mai.
Josefine Gronkrans bio
I'm a ceramicists from a rural part of Wellington who take inspiration from the beauty of Creation. I moved to beautiful Aotearoa from Sweden a few years ago, and my journey with ceramics started in 2023 and I've been elbows deep in clay ever since. I use flora found all over the world, and outside my doorsteps, to shape my artwork. My ceramic pieces are all hand made and no piece will be the other alike. I mainly throw a shape on the wheel and then let it tell me what it wants to become.
This exhibition is guided by Ecclesiastes 3:1-11. I think life is beautiful in it's times of joy, but also in the times of struggle, where we can grow and learn.
A Time for Everything
There is a time for everything,
and a season for every activity under the heavens:
a time to be born and a time to die,
a time to plant and a time to uproot,
a time to kill and a time to heal,
a time to tear down and a time to build,
a time to weep and a time to laugh,
a time to mourn and a time to dance,
a time to scatter stones and a time to gather them,
a time to embrace and a time to refrain from embracing,
a time to search and a time to give up,
a time to keep and a time to throw away,
a time to tear and a time to mend,
a time to be silent and a time to speak,
a time to love and a time to hate,
a time for war and a time for peace.
What do workers gain from their toil? I have seen the burden God has laid on the human race. He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Teaching Well - Supportive schools for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), With the growing emphasis on staff wellbeing there is a plethora of workplace mental wellbeing programmes on offer. However what is meant by staff wellbeing is not often clearly defined, with many programmes focusing on work related 'stressors' for staff or using staff wellness approach.  
As part of a well school, it is just essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Take the opportunity to learn the underlying principles of wellbeing that inform a sustainable and impactful staff wellbeing plan.  
Designed specifically for the school context, the workshop examines the theory and the practice of promoting wellbeing through the lens of of being part of a school staff in 2025.
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Equipping individual staff members skills or resources to cope more effectively with the stressful or distressing aspects of their jobs or providing an employee assistance programme is only one aspect of a comprehensive staff wellbeing plan. It is common for schools to start their development of their plan at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum. Consequently the plan developed is more a welfare / wellness plan. Learn the difference between welfare, wellness and wellbeing approaches and the strengths and weaknesses of each approach. 

Meta-evaluations of workplace mental wellbeing programmes indicate that there is little evidence around the efficacy of many workplace wellbeing programmes because they do not address the organisational and systemic factors that act as either enablers of or obstacles to wellbeing. Just as it is recognised that supportive environments are foundational to wellbeing of students, so is it also for a well staff. An effective staff wellbeing programmes responds to the needs of the staff and reflects the cultural make-up of the staff, the values and character of the school. 
Drawing on collective impact and transformational change theory and Te Whare Tapa Whā, a conceptual model will be introduced that outlines the eight pou on which a staff wellbeing plan should be based. The strength of this model is that it settings or occupation specific. It requires a depth analysis of the nature, dynamics and demands of the work and the inter-relationships that occur in the work
Building of the learnings from previous workshops and feedback from participants, the workshop now offers a template to guide the development of a staff wellbeing plan
If you are wanting a workshop that will give you a pre-packaged wellbeing programme, then this workshop is not for you. Countless evaluations have shown the limited efficacy of wellbeing programmes that are "inserted" into a school. A staff wellbeing plan must grounded in and responsive to the learnings made out of the reflective analysis and staff consultation stages. In fact, the staff consultation is, in itself, is a wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 30% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs. 
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.  He currently sits on the Health and Disability Ethics Committee.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention. He wrote the first national guidelines for suicide prevention in Australian schools and undertook a review of the NZ guidelines.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 30% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

description:
WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL, WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December
