description:
Nui Hui 7, Nui Hui 7
NUI HUI 7 – LIVE AT 14 WAIU STREET
Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
Saturday 22 November 2025 | 4PM – LATE

Nui Hui is back – louder, prouder, and more unfiltered than ever. This grassroots music series is built for the people, by the people, shining a spotlight on bands who grind it out, carve their own paths, and keep live music alive.

Nui Hui 7 is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge, and soul against a true blue-collared backdrop. No industry machines, no corporate gloss – just raw, rising talent backed by the passion of locals and volunteers who believe in the power of music.

This year’s lineup is stacked with unsigned and upcoming artists from across the region and beyond:

4PM – Munkiez

With a sound as cheeky and chaotic as their name suggests, MUNKIEZ is a bluesy, funk-rock explosion that proves good times and great grooves go hand-in-hand. Hailing from Upper Hutt, this crew is all about embracing the raw energy of rock and roll while slathering on a thick coat of soulful, slinky funk.
They're not here to reinvent the wheel, but to make it spin faster, dirtier, and with a whole lot more swagger. With a dash of that no-nonsense, straight-outta-the-garage Kiwi attitude. MUNKIEZ are a band you feel in your bones, a sound that gets your head nodding and your feet moving before you even realize what's happening. They play it like they mean it, because they do.

5PM – The Groundsmen

Scott Paddock and Shane Martin formed The Groundsmen back in the heady days of 2017 and went through various drummers and bass players before finally finding stability with drummer Rowan Carlyle in 2018.

Since then they’ve played numerous gigs (one supporting Head Like A Hole in Gisborne at Smash Palace 30th anniversary) and released 3 singles on Spotify and other streaming platforms - Black Car, Supanova and Achtung Baby (check them out!).

They’ve recorded their debut album and are just about to mix it and release it.

Playing only original earthen rock punk, we always, always, perform at 110% energy levels and put on a great show with hooky uptempo toons!! With songs commenting on contemporary society and life at large all 3 members throw themselves fully into their performance and leave no energy unused. You will leave one of their shows changed.

See the excerpt from a review of a in Whanganui July 2020:

“After a quick change of equipment, The Groundsmen were next on the agenda. Proclaiming themselves to be Taranaki’s premier rock punk band, the trio wasted no time in belting out a hard and fast set of original, classic punk-inspired tunes that were lapped up by the growing gathering of punters. Bass player Scott Paddock is a tour-de-force; full of noise, energy and an appropriate rock-punk swagger. Along with guitarist Shane Martin and drummer Rowan Carlyle, The Groundsmen powered their way though and energetic set, and it was immediately evident that they were ecstatic to be back on stage and performing again after the recent enforced hiatus. The trio powered through a set of classic, no-frills, original punk inspired tracks that had almost everyone in the room either on their feet or gyrating in their seats. Definitely a crowd-pleaser, there is no doubt whatsoever that The Groundsmen were in their element, and clearly love what they do.”

….from Ambient Light, author Bridget Herlihy, 4th July 2020

6PM – Kaletta Band

Kaletta is a Latin rock band that brings together the rhythms of ska punk and gypsy sounds in Spanish. With musicians from Chile, Colombia, Argentina, Italy, the UK, and New Zealand, our sound is a blend of different beats and roots. We've had the privilege of being two-time national finalists in the Battle of the Bands (BOTB 2024 and 2025) and have performed at festivals like Island Bay and toured the top South Island. We're excited about our upcoming tours in New Zealand next year.

What we're passionate about is creating music that's true to ourselves. Each song is a journey, moving from calm to energetic moments that we hope will keep you engaged. Our lyrics touch on social and political themes, and we hope our performances will inspire thought and conversation. We're looking forward to sharing our music with you and creating memorable experiences through our dynamic sound and energy.

7PM – Burning Embers

Accustomed to breaching anything that requires sociable etiquette they still manage to pull off their unique brand of Wainuiomata rock.

From out of nowhere, they regroup, drink a few, set a plan, and do the complete opposite in tasteful fashion. Burning Embers have an uncanny habit of pulling off a great set, usually unscripted but full of the essence that is Rock n Roll. We're not here long enough to care, but we do love a great audience
Reminiscent of Days of the New and Alice in Chains they're definitely genuine entertainment

8PM – Stretch to Mould

Stretch to Mould is a rock band from Wellington New Zealand who formed in 2012. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Darrell Vickers, who has been the only constant member throughout multiple line up changes. Since 2024 the line up has consisted of Vickers alongside Chris Fursdon (bass guitar) and Thomas Fuller (Drums). Stretch to Mould are known for their high energy, hard hitting riffs, powerful vocals and all-round solid musicianship. The band released their debut album Shadows in 2012, EP Painting Faces in 2014 and are currently working on their next release.

9PM – Ras Judah and the Culture Embassy

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

10PM – The Fabulous Pakehas

Were first conceived in London England, way back in the early 90s whilst on O.E's. Currently working on a album, & after 33 years, still in no rush.
With two of us having roots in WOA TFP are honoured to be playing a set of our originals for NUI HUI 7
The T.F.P original line up are, Antony Maddock, Scott McGill, Leslie Tearne, &
Bevan Ritchie.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From soul-stirring grooves to fist-in-the-air anthems, Nui Hui 7 is more than just a gig – it’s a celebration of musicians who hustle, create, and share their art on their own terms.

Nui Hui: supporting local, celebrating original, and keeping the fire of live music burning

description:
Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird with Araiyah & Izzy, Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird with Araiyah & Izzy
Join us for a magical evening of music at Firebird Café, Levin.

These amazing Wellington acts are coming through to present their beautiful sounds and share their heart and soul with you. We warmly invite you to join us and become a part of this collaboration of creativity and connection; spanning triumph and heartbreak, and everything in between, celebrating all it means to be human.

Our wonderful hosts at Firebird Café will be serving their delicious food and creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Tickets are $15 online or $20 on the door.

Araiyah & Izzy:

Born in the coastal town of Patea and raised in the vibrant community of Gisborne, Araiyah’s musical journey is as rich and diverse as her heritage. Now based in Wellington, she is not just a musician but a devoted mother of four tamariki and a proud grandmother to one mokopuna. For the past decade, Araiyah has poured her heart into writing, recording, and performing her original compositions, each note resonating with the depth of her experiences.

Araiyah’s music is a poignant reflection of her life’s journey, weaving together themes of love, loss, and resilience. Her deeply moving compositions are rooted in the lessons learned through relationships and the pain that often accompanies them. Through her art, she shares a narrative of healing, transformation, and the strength that comes from embracing vulnerability.

Influenced by a diverse array of artists such as Bic Runga, Tracy Chapman, and The Eagles, Araiyah’s sound is a fusion of heartfelt storytelling and melodic richness. However, it is her whanau and friends who serve as her greatest inspiration, fuelling her passion and creativity. Their support and love provide the foundation upon which her music thrives, making each performance an authentic expression of her gratitude and connection to those who matter most.

With a voice that captivates and lyrics that resonate, Araiyah invites listeners into her world—a place where pain transforms into beauty, and healing becomes a shared experience. As she continues to evolve as an artist, Araiyah’s music promises to touch the hearts of many, leaving a lasting impact on all who have the privilege of listening.

Araiyah will be accompanied by guitarist Izzy and Laura Chester-Murphy on percussion.

Rain and the Urban Bohemians:

Formed around the music of singer-songwriter Cathy Elizabeth aka Rain, supported by her band of Urban Bohemians, this group has been able to weave together many different influences and styles to create something quite unique and beautiful.

Peppered with contemplations of our existence and the fleetingness of time, Rain & the UBs bring the magic with a folk-rock edge and an alluring authenticity at its centre. Spiritual undertones and overtones give way to an uplifting joyfulness, of triumph over difficulties and life lessons learned and expressed through music.

With Cathy Elizabeth on vocals & acoustic guitar, Chris Ewers on bass, Murray James on drums and Izzy and Dion on guitars, these guys have got the goods and are ready to deliver!

So come along and allow yourself to be immersed and transported, moved and entertained. It’s going to be a very special night all round!

description:
Waikanae Makeup Masterclass - 27.09 @2 pm, About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.

description:
Crazy Ladies, Pamela Browne has organised a 25 year reunion for her four best friends from High School. From the moment Kay, now a chocoholic gun-toting funeral director arrives, the wheels begin falling off Pamela’s meticulously planned weekend.
Added to the mix is Sandy, who is now a Nun, Dianne, married the school nerd and is a mother of eight sons, Rachel, a runaway teenager on a mission to dig up some dirt on her mother, and Shaun, the greasy motel janitor, who ends up in a compromising position in the ladies’ wardrobe.
Guns, gags, cuffs, crucifixes, sleaze-balls , slander, pizza and pinot – everything you need for a great weekend reunion!

description:
Sourdough for Beginners - Tinui, Wairarapa, Sourdough for Beginners - Tinui, Wairarapa
Hey Sourdough Fans (to be)
I’m hosting a demo in Tinui!

I'm delighted to be able to offer a Sourdough Demonstration at Tinui Hall, 3 Blackhill Road, Sunday 2nd November 2-4pm.

This demonstration will take you through the whole process from the beginning to end with all the bits in between, including:
🍞Why sourdough?
🍞Getting your starter going and starter care
🍞Making your dough, including info about flours and gluten sensitivity
🍞Fermentation
🍞Dough turning
🍞Baking
🍞Storage of your bread and uses
🍞Recipe, sourdough schedule, and useful links resource to take home

Cups of tea & coffee, connection and much more!

Maria attended a demonstration last year and here’s what she said….
"I had wanted to try making sourdough for a while but had always thought it looked too complicated. Charlotte’s class helped explain and simplify so many things. It was such a great morning and I would highly recommend this class for beginners. Lots of great tips! I am now hooked!" Thanks again Charlotte 🙂

I'm offering this Demonstration for Koha/Donation. The booking link will give you the option for your koha/donation with a suggested donation of $39.

Click the link below to secure your seat.
Spaces are limited - get in quick, you won't want to miss out!

https://buy.stripe.com/9B6dR8eLB07G3lydOwfrW0r

A reminder email will be sent out closer to the time.

I look forward to sharing this passion of mine with you soon.
Charlotte x

Refund Policy:
No refunds given if you change your mind after 27th October or you do not attend.

description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

Spots are limited - grab your ticket today.

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal
Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.

Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.

The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.

---


DSLB

DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.

https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/

---

vegetable.machine.animal

New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.

https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/album/my-daughter-the-spider


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth

Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.

Non-Members:

rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245

A presto!
Photo courtesy of The Pines.
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.

description:
Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025, Jazz and Beyond for students 19 and under
December 15–18, 2025
Coordinated by Chris Beernink, Dave Wilson, Daniel Hayles, and Lance Philip. Proudly supported by the Tauranga Jazz Society.
Take your playing to the next level at the Jazz and Beyond Workshops! Young musicians from across Aotearoa come together to dive into jazz and connected styles, working closely with some of the country’s leading performers and educators. In a friendly, inclusive environment, you’ll grow your skills, make new musical connections, and learn alongside other students your age from all around the motu.
Here’s what’s in store:
small group ensembles led by professional musicians
developing improvisation skills in supportive settings
an introduction to music production
listening sessions that expand your skills
inclusive jam sessions where all are welcome
ensemble performances at the end of week concert
And more!
If you're 19 or under with at least a year of experience on your instrument or in vocal training, you’re welcome to join. Choose from trumpet, trombone, saxophone, clarinet, flute, bass, piano, guitar, drums, vibraphone, or voice.
The workshops are held at the New Zealand School of Music—Te Kōkī at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. Follow the Jazz and Beyond Workshops on Instagram or Facebook for the latest updates. Email jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com with any questions.
Schedule
The workshops run 9:00am–4:30pm Monday through Thursday, with evening activities including concerts and our inclusive jam sessions Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Students perform in a closing concert on Thursday afternoon.
Accommodation
Students arrange their own accommodation. Often students from outside Wellington stay together in groups with a parent chaperone. Options for housing near Victoria University of Wellington include backpacker hostels and hotels. If you have a group of 15 or more, University Student Housing can been booked at Cumberland House. Contact info for this option is via email at Cumberland-House@vuw.ac.nz or by phone at +64 4 463 4770.
Meals
Lunch for the four days is available for purchase at many convenient locations on campus, or students may bring their own lunch.
Equipment
Provided equipment includes drum kits, guitar and bass amps, pianos/keyboards, microphones and PAs for vocalists.
All brass and wind players should bring their own instruments.
Drummers: you are required to bring your own cymbals, sticks, and hi-hat clutch.
Guitarists and bass players: you are required to bring your own instruments as well as cables (leads).
Preparation
All students with one year of experience on an instrument or in vocal training have the skills required to participate, so no musical preparation is required. On the first day, students will play a very short audition to be placed in an appropriate ensemble. Guidelines for this short audition will be sent to all registered participants in advance of the workshops.
Cost
Early bird price: $325 - register by 19th October
Standard price $350 - after 19th October
Registration is open to all until all spots are filled.
We are dedicated to ensuring all students can participate in the workshops without financial constraints. If the cost poses a barrier, please email us at jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com and we will find a solution to facilitate your participation!

The band is hitting the road to fundraise for a European tour in 2026, so you're not only getting to see one of the most fun bands New Zealand has to offer. You are helping them debut there!

Chris Dent, Pascal Roggen, Hannah De Koster and Micheal Young play original songs that are relatable and catchy, dancing on the edge of what could be considered folk. Intricate arrangements are filled with harmony, soaring violin, and most of all. Joy.

Beth Britten presented this music at her gig 'Not What I Planned' with a quartet in Tāmaki Makaurau earlier this year. She is excited to be bringing this explorative music to Pōneke in a trio format for the Wellington Jazz Festival.

description:
Music at the Museum, A very full afternoon programme of: The Grey Warblers from 2pm until 3pm - A duo of two vastly experienced and much-loved local jazz musicians. Patrick Bleakley is one of the busiest and most loved jazz musicians in the New Zealand music scene. He began his bass playing career with legendary Kiwi group Blerta and has since performed with a who’s who of New Zealand jazz including Jonathan Crayford, Alda Rezende, The Troubles, Ben Wilcock and many more. Kim Workman's music career started in Greytown round 1954, with a trio that played for local dances and
events. He then spent the next forty years, as a resident piano player, (e.g. Orsinis Restaurant) and pianist/keyboard player in jazz groups in Wellington, Hutt Valley, Rotorua, Whakatane, and Auckland until 2000, when my work responsibilities took over, apart from occasional Jazz Festivals and special occasions. A chance conversation brought them together and now they are enjoying playing the Great American Songbook: the numbers that Frank Sinatra, Tony Bennett, Ella Fitzgerald, and more recently, Diane Krall and Michael Buble made famous, as well as more contemporary numbers and some originals.
12.30pm - The Greytown Songsters: our local community choir will charm us with a programme of well loved favourites.
1pm - 2pm: The Troubador Singers - the community choir from Masterton who love to entertain and sing for the joy of singing together. Gold Coin Koha appreciated Come and enjoy an afternoon of song and music in the beautiful acoustic space of Cobblestones Museum.

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington), SOLD OUT!!!!
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.

Auckland DJ Lady Fee and Wellington violinist Ana Henderson unite their talents through a shared love of hypnotic beats, soaring melodies, and emotive dancefloor experiences. Lady Fee’s meticulously mixed sets are complimented by Ana’s classically trained violin, adding a soulful, improvisational edge, shaped by influences from Balkan folk and gypsy jazz to Americana and swing.

description:
The Racket Lounge: Session Four, Grab a spot on our couch and enjoy the noise at The Racket Lounge, a chill classical music series featuring up-and-coming Pōneke classical and jazz musicians.

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
First Reserve, Dropper & Elly Mae, Get ready for another memorable night out as First Reserve & Dropper share the bill with rising star Elly Mae. This will be an evening to feast your ears on a diverse soundscape of angular guitars, melodic goodness, and glorious noise.

Here’s the lo-down:

First Reserve is inevitable. Before adopting the moniker in 2023, Ryan Connaghan had been prolifically writing music that communicated their experiences in life, love, and loneliness. These themes are all approached on songs like “Last One” and “Me & My Friends” – the first offerings from First Reserve’s debut EP set for release in late 2025. On stage, their sound is both intimate and larger-than-life, combining influences from alt-rock, indie-folk, and pop.

Dropper combines intuitive songwriting sensibilities with wall-of-sound, guitar.  Blending noise and melody, Dropper is dynamic, song-centred, high-energy indie rock. Often compared to Bob Mould’s work with Hüsker Dü or Lou Barlow's early Sebadoh, they’ve been described by one review as having a "high energy stage performance punctuated by flawless musicianship and songwriting skills that seems beyond the years...Honestly, it’s hard to overstate how impressed I was with Dropper and am eagerly awaiting my next chance to see them live.”

Elly Mae's music encapsulates the bittersweet complexities of growth, relationships, time escaping, and the nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, shoegaze and whatnot.

Grab your general release tickets online for just $15! Or, even better, grab an early bird ticket for only $10 and secure your spot for a night of unforgettable live music. Doors at 8pm, first act on at 8:30pm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
BEN WILCOCK AND THE JELLY ROLLS, Ben Wilcock and The Jelly Rolls have been a mainstay on the Aotearoa jazz scene for the last 15 years. Their two studio albums are a collection of piano trio jazz, with the pervasive pianistic influences of Erroll Garner, Fats Waller, Oscar Peterson and Ahmad Jamal.
They have toured New Zealand extensively and performed internationally, including a sold-out performance at The Edinburgh Jazz Festival in 2019. Along with unique interpretations of jazz piano standards, the trio's repertoire includes original material from Wilcock's recently released album The River Tethys, as well as the solo piano album Goodnight T.V.

description:
Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?, He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.

Access information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku (toilet) at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. description:
Jewellery Making - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens, Craft your own rings in this introduction to metal-smithed jewellery making! In this quick paced one session workshop you’ll learn some metalworking fundamentals to turn raw silver, copper and brass into shining wearable rings. Use hammers and stamps to add textures and simple lettering to customise your creation!

Techniques covered:

- Use sizers and jeweller’s callipers to measure ring size
- Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces
- Use hammers and stamps to texture and form metal
- Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal
- Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery

Minimum age is 13 years. This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, pottery, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Employment Law Session - Casual Employment & Trial Periods | Marlborough, Following on from our Disciplinary Process Workshop in 2024, we are pleased to bring you another practical and informative session designed to support employers in navigating the complexities of employment law. Join us for Employment Law 101, where we’ll cover the essential elements of starting the employment relationship on the right foot. 
This workshop will provide clarity around: 
When and how to use trial periods lawfully 
What defines casual employment and how to manage it correctly 
Best practice for offering employment and ensuring your documentation is spot-on 
Common pitfalls employers face in the hiring process and how to avoid them 
This session is ideal for business owners, managers, and anyone involved in hiring or managing staff. Whether you're new to employing or just need a refresher, you’ll walk away with greater confidence and a clearer understanding of your obligations.
The workshop will be delivered by Tim Blake, General Counsel for Hospitality New Zealand, and includes time for questions and discussion.
Don’t miss this opportunity to strengthen your employment practices and stay on the right side of the law.

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements
Price and promote your product for global shelves
Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz

WellyForge#4, 17th Sept 2025, Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up. The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
The September event is sponsored by Diana Minnee and Astronort and will have two main talks & Q/A from Wellington-based:
Matt Hayter, Founder & President of Projectworks, HITECH Emerging Company of the Year, who raised over $12m at a valuation of over $100m in 2025.
Dave Shoemack, CEO of Goodnature, Wellington Gold Supreme winner 2025.
We'll also have 3 short talks from Wellington-based:
Viv Baartman, CEO of Uunafit, custom-made clothing design, Wellington Gold Innovation winner 2025.
Joanna Struthers, CEO of legal start-up Navigater
Roydon Goldstack, PhD at Vic looking at emotion & bodily activity and "Using Generative AI to create Emotional Human Characters"
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!
Join WellyForge

description:
90-Day Business Plan Workshop - 24/9, Create Your 90-Day Business Plan
Are you a small business owner, unsure of where to focus your efforts, possibly feeling overwhelmed by the tasks ahead?
Introducing the 90-Day Business Planning workshop
📅 Wednesday 24/9/25 From 9:00am-1:00pm At 3/15 Daly Street, Lower Hutt
If you’ve been thinking that you need to start working ON your business
(rather than just IN the business), or maybe you are feeling unsure of
where to focus your efforts, or perhaps you are even becoming
overwhelmed by the tasks ahead - You're not alone.
Many entrepreneurs face this struggle.
This lack of direction is not only frustrating - it's a huge roadblock.
Introducing the 90-Day Business Planning Experience
In just half a day, you will be creating and walk out with a ready-to-execute 90-day plan that will give you the clarity and focus you need to move forward with confidence., and then at 30-day and 60-day online follow-up session to keep your progress
What You'll Walk Away With:
A Clear Strategy: Get into the right mindset for success as you connect your passion and goals to a focused 90-day plan that moves your business forward.
An Actionable Plan: Breakdown your big goals into clear, doable weekly steps, making it easy to stay on track and see real progress.
Inspiration & Connection: Learn, share, and grow alongside other business owners, gaining fresh insights, motivation, and a powerful networking opportunity.
Why You Need This Now:
Without a business plan, you are more likely to miss opportunities, waste time, and burn out.
Businesses with formal plans are more likely to succeed and achieve long-term growth.
The time to act is now - this session is your key to getting your business forward successfully.
Stop Going in Circles: 
Invest just half a day, where you’ll be able to create a 90-day business plan that’s ready to execute.
You'll feel empowered to move forward with purpose and clarity as you get to connect with other business owners at the same time.

description:
The Workplace Rituals Deck Facilitator Masterclass, Build culture by design, not by default - one ritual at a time.
Facilitate meaningful culture change and create connection through the power of workplace rituals.
This masterclass is for people who want to build stronger, more connected workplace cultures — and are ready to turn values and intentions into real, daily action.
Whether you're a leader, culture champion, facilitator, or change consultant, this training will give you the tools and confidence to run your own Workplace Rituals Workshops using the WRD (Workplace Rituals Deck).
Led by the co-creators of the deck, Lotty Roberts and Lorissa Garcia, this is a hands-on learning experience rooted in emotional culture, intentional design, and purposeful leadership.
In this Masterclass, you'll learn:
What rituals are and why they are important
Why rituals matter in workplaces
The difference between habits and rituals
Indepth knowledge of each of the 4 parts of the deck and why they are important
How to use our PARR model to craft rituals that stick
How to run the Rituals Audit
How to guide groups through ideation, crafting and action
Lotty & Lorissa's tips and tricks for using the deck first hand, along with the story and background behind the deck.
You'll walk away as a Certified Workplace Rituals Deck Practitioner, with confidence to run rituals sessions with your own teams or clients.
What's Included:
3.5 hour in person masterclass
Co-led by the WRD creators: Lotty Roberts & Lorissa Garcia
Certification as a WRD Practitioner
Digital Toolkit
Option to purchase with or without a deck.
Who it’s for:
Leaders & Team Managers
Culture Champions
Small business owners wanting to create an intentional culture as they scale
HR, OD, and Change Practitioners
Leadership Development Consultants
Facilitators & Coaches
Anyone who wants to turn values into action and create emotionally intelligent, connected teams and workplaces
Why Join? Because culture doesn't live in a document. It lives in the small, intentional things we do every day. This masterclass gives you the tools and confidence to help others design those moments — and build workplaces where people feel connected, seen and supported.
Culture happens with or without you - rituals help make it intentional.
Presented by the WRD Co-creators:
Lorissa (founder of Assembly Culture) and Lotty Roberts (founder of MiND.U) met through their shared work in emotional culture, leadership, and change - and quickly became friends as well as collaborators.
After years of working with teams and leaders, they kept noticing the same thing: workshops sparked insight, but translating that energy into everyday action was where things fell short.
So they created The Workplace Rituals Deck - a practical, human way to close the gap between knowing and doing. It’s full of simple, powerful rituals to help teams shape a culture that’s not just talked about, but genuinely felt.
Ticket Options:
Masterclass Only – $299 NZD
Masterclass + WRD Deck – $529 NZD (Deck provided on the day at in-person events.)
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break.
Date and time
29th October 2025
9:00 AM – 12:30 PM NZST
Location
Willeston Conference Centre
Level 11  
15 Willeston Street
Call Active House
Wellington 6011
New Zealand 
View Map
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately we do not offer refunds for this workshop.
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify the host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop and have purchased a deck we will send that to you along with the digital toolkit.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
TENZ Conference 2025, TENZ Conference 2025
TENZ invites you to our 2025 Conference - Inspiring Ākonga Empowering Kaiako, to be held at Wellington East Girls' College, 131 Austin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011.

The conference is designed for teachers and researchers at all levels of technology education and will provide opportunities to connect with, and learn from, other members of the community as well as get up to date with new products, tools and opportunities that support students’ learning in technology.

Register here: https://tenz.org.nz/2025-conference/

With over 50 sessions spanning the full spectrum of technology education - from food, textiles, DVC, and STEAM to digital, vocational, and emerging tech - there’s something for every kaiako, at every level. Dive into workshops on AI, AR, and rockets; explore neuro inclusion, culturally sustaining practice, and curriculum integration; get practical with tools like Minecraft, WorldPainter, and Brisk; or collaborate on pathways, assessment, and cross-curricular design thinking. Whether you're refining your NCEA practice, reigniting creativity, or discovering new ways to inspire ākonga, these sessions are designed to spark ideas, deepen confidence, and empower you to lead change in your classroom and community. This is your chance to connect, create, and be part of shaping the future of technology education in Aotearoa.

description:
Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly., Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.
At MOX, we're a small, family-run business based in beautiful Aotearoa, New Zealand. Founded and led by two partners who've shared life's journey for over 25 years, we bring a unique blend of personal commitment and professional expertise to every interaction.

We're not your typical consultants. Instead, we're hands-on experts in procurement and contract management, driven by a desire to create real, lasting change. Our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes, helping you secure the best deals, avoid pitfalls, and gain the kind of commercial protection usually reserved for the big players. We believe in enabling your success by ensuring your contracts and purchasing processes truly work for you.

Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.

Procurement Case Studies - The Bad: How things can go wrong and cost you $$$.
Contract Myth Busting - The Ugly: Why we should embrace contracts; they aren’t “ugly”.
Best Practice - The Good: How good procurement & contracts will “save the day” and protect your business.
Contract Counselling: Tell us about your “bad(s)”. We will guide you on how you can make it “good”.
We have an amazing new innovation that we want to introduce at the session (during the Best Practice part) called Kitset Contract. Kitset Contract is going to empower sole traders & small to medium sized enterprises to truly be able to create and use their own contracts; Allowing them to better protect their business and their hard earned $$$.

Everyone who attends the session will receive a discount code meaning their first contract will be only $49.99 (a $100 discount).

RSVP Here: https://www.kapitichamber.org.nz/events#!event/2025/8/5/l-d-procurement-contract-myths-8211-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly

Pukeahu Park Tour, Whether you visit Pukeahu every Anzac Day or pass through on your daily commute, have you ever paused to look closer?
Join us for a walk through the park led by an expert guide, and gain a deeper understanding of Pukeahu, the memorials, and the people they honour.

This special guided tour covers a broad range of narratives, whether you’re interested in design and architecture, place-based histories or want to reflect on New Zealand’s military experiences. The tour begins at the fountain below the Tomb of the Unknown Warrior.
This is an accessible tour. Bring clothing for the weather and any burning questions.

description:
Poetry Slam: Regional Heat #1, This PIM event is a Poetry Slam! The first of three regional heats leading to the regional finals at the National Library on October 11th.
This Poetry In Motion Slam is the first heat for the 2025 Wellington Poetry Slam Champs. The top three scoring poets from this event will gain a spot in the regional finals!
Poets who want to sign up for the slam, please drop an email to:
travis.cottreau@gmail.com
subject: slam heat #1
What is a slam?
A Poetry Slam is a competitive poetry event where poets compete for points. Five random audience members are tasked with being the judges and they score each poem out of 10 to one decimal place.
The number of poets involved and number of rounds can change event-to-event, but there are some universal rules – no props, no costumes, poems must be three minutes or less, poets must read original work, and no punching down or hate speech.
Price on the door is $5
The top four poets from each heat will go through to the Wellington Poetry Slam Champs at the National Library of New Zealand on October 11th.
Other heats:
Sunday the 21st Sept
Thursday the 2nd October
Finals: Saturday, 11th October.

description:
Astronomy on Tap, Astronomy on Tap
Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.

This September at Astronomy on Tap, we’re diving into one of the biggest questions in science: Are we alone? Our theme is The Search for Life and Water. Wherever we find water on Earth, we find life. Could the same be true beyond our planet?

From icy moons in our Solar System to distant exoplanets, scientists are searching for the conditions that could support life. Join us as we explore the potential for discovering life in the universe and the technology helping us get closer to the answer.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.

Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 7 Oct, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, $20 -tickets via link: https://events.humanitix.com/gong-bath-at.../tickets
*Limited door sales for $25*
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable *
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.

During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.

Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.

Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.

**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY**

Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.

- water bottle
- journal and pen

If you've never participated in breathwork before, here are a few contraindications:
Physical Contraindications
-Cardiovascular issues
-Glaucoma
-High blood pressure (Over time, if untreated, it can cause health conditions, such as heart disease and stroke) Deep-breathing lowers blood pressure.
-Epilepsy
-Detached Retina (Retinal detachment separates the retinal cells from the layer of blood vessels that provides oxygen and nourishment).
-History of strokes or seizures
-Aneurysm or family history of aneurysm. (Burst blood vessels in the brain).
-Blood thinning medication. (Unfortunately, the blood thinners used to prevent such blood clots can increase the risk of bleeding in the brain, a cause of hemorrhagic stroke).
-Pregnancy or possible pregnancy
-Asthma
-Mental Contraindications
-Substance dependence & addiction (Deep breathwork journeys are not always appropriate for those who are still addicted to a substance, as it tends to raise suppressed or repressed material for processing. However, if you’re currently in recovery, this can be extremely healing, and help you discover the deeper patterns that gave rise to this addiction. (Grof, 1985: 267 – 268).
-Bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or psychosis
-Hospitalisation for emotional crises in the last 10 years
-Psychological conditions and diagnoses, which preclude safe emotional release.

If you are affected by any of the above, please inform Sarah.

*Tickets are non-refundable, but are transferrable with 24 hours notice required.

description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
Death Cafe Newtown, Death Cafe runs monthly on the 2nd Saturday.
Let's normalise our own demise! We are all going to die, let's talk about it. At a Death Café people - often strangers - gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Death Café is not a grief support group, or counselling session - instead it is a place to discuss death without expectations. The objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'.
For more information about Death Cafes generally, check deathcafe.com
For any pātai about this Death Cafe, email info@newtowncommunity.org.nz / call 04 389 4786

description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt, Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 9th Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”
hi@lynofuro.co.nz |
www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
Wellington Walk the Waterfront, Wellington Walk the Waterfront
Top Up Together

As part of Mental Health Awareness Week’s Be Active day, the Aotearoa Mental Health Collective invites you to join us for an evening of movement, connection and community.
We’ll gather at The Lounge at St John's Bar, Wellington from 5.30 pm for a warm welcome and a chance to connect. Then at 6 pm we'll take a walk along the beautiful Wellington waterfront, returning to The Lounge at St John's around 6.45 pm.
After the walk, you’ll have the opportunity to share a meal or snacks of your choice, deepen connections, and continue the conversation in a relaxed setting. As this is a free event, you’ll order and pay for any food and drinks yourself and can choose from the wide range on offer at St John's Bar.
Walking alongside others and taking the time to connect can boost our wellbeing, reduce stress, lift our mood and strengthen our sense of belonging.
Spaces are limited, so secure your spot today.
We look forward to connecting, walking and topping up our wellbeing together this Mental Health Awareness week.

With thanks to St John's Bar, who have generously provided the venue for this free event.

The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
If your brain won’t stop running in circles, this workshop is for you.
In 60 minutes, we’ll unpack why your mind loves to overthink, how to break out of thought spirals before they swallow your day, and I’ll guide you through a relaxing hypnosis to quiet the noise on the spot. You’ll leave with simple tools you can use anytime life feels too loud.


Meet your host, Gopi
Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity, overcome negative thought patterns and habits through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, trauma informed coach, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.
6.15pm Tuesday 9th September

description:
Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington, Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington
For practices,clinics & care teams ready to adopt Heidi—the AI scribe for all clinicians. Join us in Wellington. Hosted by Hendrix Health.

About this Event



Experience the Future of Clinical Documentation with Heidi & Hendrix
This event is perfect for practices and clinics looking to bring —the AI medical scribe for all clinicians—into their organisation. Heidi can be used by doctors, nurses, pharmacists, physios, psychologists, vetenarians and more, supporting everything from patient consults and shift handovers to practice meetings and MDMs.
Built with robust data privacy and compliance in mind, Heidi scales to fit how your clinic operates, so you can spend less time on paperwork and more time on patient care. We’ll also discuss safe AI adoption in healthcare, including how Heidi respects data sovereignty in Aotearoa. This session is designed to be straightforward and practical—no hype, just a real look at how AI can transform your everyday workflow.

About Heidi is an AI-powered medical scribe designed to ease the documentation load on clinicians. Already supporting over a million patient interactions every week, Heidi transcribes and processes clinical conversations in real time—helping generate notes, letters, and assessments so clinicians can spend more time with patients and less on paperwork.
Built by a team of doctors and backed by leading global investors, Heidi has become a trusted partner for practices and clinics around the world. The technology is developed to meet international standards including HIPAA, GDPR, NHS and the Australian Privacy Principles, with enterprise-grade certifications like SOC2 and ISO27001.
Heidi never stores session recordings and does not sell or share clinical data. It's designed with clinician wellbeing, patient care, and data safety at its core. Learn more at heidihealth.com.

About
Hendrix Health, Heidi’s official partner in Aotearoa New Zealand , is dedicated to transforming healthcare through life-long learning and human-centred technology. Since September 2024, the Hendrix team have visited over 120 GP clinics, 10 hauora Māori, and 6 Pasifika providers to understand the real challenges on the ground. By working closely with local communities, Hendrix Health ensures that revolutionary innovations like Heidi are culturally responsive and truly effective—already changing the lives of 1000's of healthcare professionals across the country.


Agenda


🕑: 05:00 PM - 06:00 PM
Networking on Arrival (Whakawhanaungatanga)
Info: Arrive, grab a drink, some kai, and connect with fellow attendees. This is your chance to meet new faces, catch up with colleagues, and set a welcoming tone for the evening.


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:10 PM
Opening Karakia & Whakatauki
Info: We’ll open with a brief karakia (blessing) to acknowledge our gathering, focus our intentions, and bring everyone together under a shared purpose. A short whakatauki will be shared, reminding us why we’re here: to improve healthcare for all in Aotearoa.



🕑: 06:10 PM - 06:15 PM
Current Pressues in your Work
Info: A quick reflection on everyday challenges—like documentation fatigue, paperwork overload, and time inefficiencies—that impact both workflow and patient care.



🕑: 06:15 PM - 06:30 PM
Heidi Demo
Info: We’ll show how Heidi fits into your clinical workflow, covering:


- Who is Heidi? Background and purpose.


- AI Scribing Basics: Four steps (Transcribe, Customise, Output, Review).


- Live Demo: A clinician–patient consultation, including informed consent and template use.


- SOAP Formatting & Note Review: How Heidi helps structure and refine notes.


- Ask Heidi Anything: See how to generate a patient letter or other documents directly from the consultation.


🕑: 06:30 PM - 06:40 PM
Principles of Safe AI Use in Healthcare/Data Handling
Info: Explore data privacy, sovereignty, and compliance in Aotearoa, plus best practices for responsibly adopting AI in clinical settings.


🕑: 06:40 PM - 06:45 PM
Karakia Whakamutunga
Info: We’ll close the formal session with a karakia, acknowledging the time shared and the insights gained.


🕑: 06:45 PM - 08:00 PM
Networking
Info: Continue conversations, ask further questions, and connect with the team. Wrap up the evening with new insights and meaningful connections.

description:
6 Week Yoga Course for Beginners, The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.

Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.
This course called "part 1" will cover the second half of Level 1 from the System of Yoga in Daily Life.

Join Tara Goddard for this Breathwork Medicine Journey connecting through breath and alchemising its medicine through waves of the body.

Breathwork is an ancient technique used for healing & expansion to bridge the gap between your human self & higher self.

Alternate states of awareness are created, where waves of emotion, thought or somatic sensation are able to roll through and release with the breath.

BreathWav not only works with somatic intelligence, but nervous system attunement, working with the denser and more subtle layers of the body to raise & uplift.

Breathwork may cause the release of
DMT (Spirit Molecule) it is an alchemy with brainwaves and cerebrospinal fluid. Gamma brainwaves are associated with states of deep meditation, heightened awareness, and higher brain functions.

Breathwork and other deeply meditative practices activate gamma waves and there is a correlation between gamma waves and DMT release, with one seeming to stimulate the other.

Breathwork experiences and benefits so often parallel those of DMT and other psychedelic plant-medicines, DMT is produced naturally in the brain, and is released during Breathwork.

A breathwork journey is unique to each person and and the results are profound.

Breathwork results in certain specific physiological changes in the body and also can result in intense physical and emotional release.

As a precaution, the following conditions are contraindicated in certain breathwork practices.

It is crucial that you inform your breathwork practitioner if any of the following conditions are relevant to you:

• Pregnancy (at any stage)

• Severe PTSD or trauma

• Currently using recreational drugs

• Recent surgery

• Taking any medication that alters brain chemistry like anti-anxiety,anti-depressant, ADD, OCD medications, etc.

•Detached Retina

•Glaucoma

•Kidney disease

•High Blood Pressure

•Cardiovascular disease, including angina, previous heart attack or stroke
•Diagnosis of aneurysm in the brain or abdomen

•Uncontrolled thyroid conditions

•Diabetes

•Severe Asthma— for mild to moderate asthma, we can discuss but you must bring your inhaler to the session.

• Epilepsy

• History of Seizures

• Prior diagnosis of bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or previous psychiatric condition.

•Any other medical, psychiatric or physical conditions which would impair or affect the ability to engage in any activities that involve deep physical and/or emotional release.

𝙁𝘼𝙌’𝙨:

What can I expect?

There will be a short guided meditation, explanation of conscious connected breathwork (how to do it, tetany, things that may happen etc), a full 60 min breathwork journey and space afterwards for a few to share about their experience and any questions asked and support given if needed.

I have one or more of the listed contraindications - what should I do?

Email or message Tara to let her know what these are and she’ll let you know if she can offer adjustments so you can attend.
