description:
Gut Health - With Nutritionist Lucy Edwards, Gut Health - With Nutritionist Lucy Edwards
Do you suffer from bloating, constipation, stomach cramps, weight gain, stubborn fat, or a low mood? Or do you just want you and your family to be healthier?

Did you know your gut influences every aspect of you health and wellbeing?

In this fun, relaxing, educational and interactive workshop, you will learn from one of New Zealand's leading Nutritionists Lucy Edwards. Lucy will guide you through some easy and effective tips that you can use to improve your health today. You will also be provided organic herbal teas to sip on chosen especially for gut health.

More about your host Nutritionist Lucy Edwards
A qualified Nutritionist, Natural Therapist and health and wellness expert with more than 20 years experience. She is also an author of 'The Grumbles' a children's book about having a positive mindset.

Lucy is also available to provide workshops and wellness retreats both in person and online, on a range of health-related topics. She will tailor these to suit the participants and the topics they are most interested in or concerned about, such as popular diet and exercise trends and the research around these, or information regarding Health and Nutrition in general. Some of her high end clients include Shortland Street Actors, International Comedians, Olympic Athletes and NZ Army Fitness Instructors.

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. The first Ecstatic Dance Wellington is here — come celebrate our launch at Vogelmorn with DJ Kimba Jade on the decks. 🌙❤️

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington – Launch Event ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to bring Ecstatic Dance Wellington to life! 🎉 This is the launch event, and we can’t wait to co-create the first of many transformational dance journeys with you.

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and leads Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington

$30 cash on the door

☀️ Extra Info
- Beanbags are provided for the end relaxation.
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to joining the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

Water bottle

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

No phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

✨ Come help us launch Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

Tania loves creating & holding sacred space for people & in this monthly event she will be creating a space where you can focus on your own healing journey in a group environment. In each session you will be guided through clearing, releasing, healing & remembering processes to help & assist you. We will explore different tools, processes & modalities each time to experience the highest possible energetic shift that is possible at that time.

Each month will have a different focus & flavour with the intention of working on yourself in a safe held space.
Over the next 4 sessions we will explore:

The 12 Chakra system, tools to use to help clear & heal the chakras and then enjoy a beautiful energy healing with the Archangels that are connected to each of the chakras.

Angelic Reiki - Receive an Angelic Cleansing, releasing old karmic connections with Archangel Michael, followed by a group healing with the angels wanting to connect with you.

Full Sensory Perception tools through Pleiadian Lightwork - an explanation on how the tools may feel & work & being in those energies & frequencies to receive the clearing & healing that is possible.

Access Bars - How ‘running the bars’ can help, some key points to use for stress or healing, running clearing statements to release old beliefs & patterns. What else is possible & how does it get any better than this.

There is a lot to explore & embrace and there may be additional processes brought in as Tania is guided or as time allows.

First Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm $30


Tania is a gifted intuitive and holistic practitioner, known for her grounded presence and loving guidance. She is an Angelic Reiki Master Teacher, Pleiadian Lightwork Practitioner & Teacher, conscious channeler, and Access Bars Practitioner. With a rich background in intuitive and energy work, she brings a nurturing and empowering energy to both group workshops and one-on-one sessions.

description:
9 September Whisky Tasting, Whisky Tasting: 9 September 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
In September, we'll get back on track, away from the International Whiskies of our August tasting, and on to the Eastern Highlands of Scotland: Glendronach.
Named for the valley of the brambles surrounding the distillery, Glendronach was the second distillery to gain a legal whisky license, and is currently under the stewardship of Dr. Rachel Barrie, a legend in the whisky industry. Dr Barrie has recently revamped the Glendronach lineup, and we're going to see how she's doing: we'll try the previous 12 and 15 year--old bottlings against her new releases. She's worked her magic at Ben Riach, and we'll see how she's doing at Glendronach (I suspect quite well!). Additionally, we'll try the highland peated Glendronach, a departure from the familiar smokey peat of Islay. We'll expect a sweeter, softer style, bolstered by some sherry maturation.
Please join me for this wonderful tasting of Glendronachs:
Tuesday, September 9
7:30pm Start time (arrive early to get a beer and a seat)
$60 per person
Seatoun Clubhouse (16 Dundas Street, Seatoun)
See you then,
Matt

We keep track of your tab by marking the edge of your coaster and when your glass is empty - voilà, another glass appears!

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

description:
Always a Bridesmaid, Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Due Isole, Join Chef Giulio Ricatti for an extraordinary evening celebrating the bond between two islands — Sardinia and New Zealand. Through a carefully curated nine-course dinner, this event offers a personal and heartfelt exploration of identity, place, and the connection between land and sea.

Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries. Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.

Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence. The thoughtful combination of food and drink creates a dialogue between the two islands, offering diners a chance to taste the harmony of contrasts.

More than just a meal, this is an evening of storytelling. Chef Ricatti invites you to journey with him as he reflects on the places that have shaped his life and the meaning of finding a home across oceans. His philosophy of embracing the present moment is woven into every dish, making this event a sensory and emotional experience.

Whether you’re a lover of fine dining, an admirer of Sardinian culture, or simply curious about the connections between food and identity, this dinner promises a night of discovery. Step into the heart of two islands and savour their soul in one unforgettable evening.
label: Food & Drink

description:
5 Course Dinner at Le Cordon Bleu | 6 SEPTEMBER 2025, This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Intermediate Cuisine & Diplôme Avancé Culinaire students is not to be missed.
Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail nz@cordonbleu.edu to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Saturday 6th September
(We are hosting additional dinner sessions, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 5:30pm | 6:00pm | 6:30pm | 7:00pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.
What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

description:
We 💛 Mac 'n' Cheese, A feast with purpose, where every bowl makes a difference.
Celebrate the final day of Visa Wellington On a Plate and the end of winter with the ultimate comfort food: mac 'n' cheese, served all day long.

Two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh, are joining forces to serve piping hot mac 'n' cheese, raising funds to help feed the community. As official charity partners of the festival, they are turning comfort food into real impact.

For just $10, each bowl will help fund a three-course meal for someone in need through Everybody Eats or provide a day’s worth of food for a family via Kaibosh.

Customise your mac with a range of toppings and flavours, all made from rescued food, showcasing just how delicious food recovery can be. In the lead-up to the event, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh will be calling on their social media followers to share their favourite mac 'n' cheese combos, with the top picks featured on the day.

Diners can enjoy their meal seated in the Everybody Eats restaurant or opt for takeaway to share with the whānau or flat.

The goal is to serve 2,000 bowls and fund 2,000 meals for the community. Join the celebration, enjoy incredible kai and help make a real difference.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Wellington Food Show, Are you ready to reignite your passion for cooking and get inspired with new flavours? Then look no further than The Food Show, Wellington's ultimate foodie extravaganza! This isn’t just another trip to the market — it’s an immersive culinary adventure that will excite all your senses.

Prepare to witness culinary rockstars in action as they whip up their signature dishes live! Renowned chefs and culinary stars, including MasterChef winners Nadia Lim, Sam Low, and the hilarious Annabelle White, will be sharing their tips, tricks, and insider knowledge in the Chance Voight Cooking Theatre. Whether you’re looking to master a new dish or get ideas to elevate your meals, this is your chance to get inspired and bring restaurant-worthy meals into your own kitchen.

Beyond the live cooking demonstrations, The Food Show is packed with exclusive show specials you won’t want to miss. Stock up on pantry essentials at unbeatable prices, discover hidden gems from local producers, or indulge in luxurious gourmet treats — all while saving big on products you can’t find anywhere else.

Whether you're a seasoned chef or just getting started, The Food Show is your ticket to discovering the best in food, flavour, and fun.

description:
Discover the World of Chinese Milk Tea! Sip, Savor, and Explore a Cultural Icon!, Join us for a delicious journey into the world of Chinese milk tea — a beloved drink that blends flavor, tradition, and creativity. From classic black milk tea to trendy cheese foam toppings, discover what makes Chinese milk tea so irresistible!
Taste the Variety: Try popular milk tea styles from across China — including bubble tea, fruit teas, and unique toppings.
Learn the Culture: Uncover the story behind the rise of milk tea and its role in modern Chinese youth culture.
DIY Station: Mix your own milk tea creation with fun ingredients and take home your personalized blend!
Come sip with us at Mandarin Corner – where culture meets flavor!

description:
Feed Your Senses, Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

description: Love the Wine You're With, Join the team from Matahiwi Estate for a fun and fearless wine tasting. Strip away the pretense of wine while tasting six glasses from new flavours, to old favourites and unique styles all while enjoying a shared charcuterie pairing. No question is too big or small, this is your chance to sip, learn, and explore in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Come curious, leave confident or maybe just a little less confused by wine speak - but most of all, enjoy!

description:
Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy
Supporting Kaibosh., Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night!
A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy!
On 30 October, gather your cleverest friends and find your darkest ghoulish attire
Who will crack the case first: the Detectives or the Villains?

Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright
with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.
Award-winning chef Max Gordy ( @grazewinebar ) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.
TICKET TYPES
Bring a team of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table...
VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.
What is Mischief Night?
In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...

Gin and Clay Emerald Green and Turquoise Blue Wall Art Workshop, A fabulous and fun workshop that combines creativity and gin tasting for a unique experience. Create one stunning large wall art piece or two smaller pieces that will be fired and glazed in either a striking emerald green or a vibrant blue around 5 weeks after the session, making it perfect for displaying in your home or as a thoughtful gift. Alongside that sip 3 delicious Gin samples from the Bond Store distillery where we will be working.

My clay classes are suitable for complete beginners or those with experience and are a wonderful way to relax, replenish and have fun. Working with clay is good for the soul! Immersing in a gentle creative activity helps to switch off a busy mind, and making tiles is fun and achievable even if this is your first time using clay.

All materials are provided so all you need to do is turn up ready to have some fun and creativity. Booking is essential so please use this ticket link: https://forms.gle/PRLZ1JH9awDYjoNk8 or email clpates@hotmail.com.

Price includes all materials, glaze, double kiln firing and a gin tasting tray with 3 gins from The Bond Store.

description:
Houghton Valley Community Hall Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Houghton Valley Community Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Beginners: 11:00am – 1:00pm
• Returners: 1:00pm – 4:30pm (pack down starts at 4:00pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors,
• an old towel (if you have one)
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Please take any leftover harakeke home with you
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook https://www.facebook.com/TMKhuihui
Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshops, To celebrate WOW (World of Wearable Art) season here in Wellington, we're offering two beautiful aromatherapy candle-making workshops, to be held at Wellington Apothecary. These will be held in the afternoon so you can do something fun before the show or before dinner during your stay here in Wellington.

What to expect?
Discover the natural beauty of therapeutic essential oils, learn about scent layering, design your own signature scent and make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle.

When? Friday 19 September, 3pm to 5pm and Friday 3 October, 4pm to 6pm
Where? Wellington Apothecary, Cuba Mall, Wellington

____

What's included in the workshop...

Be guided by Melanie of Poet Botanicals and discover the natural beauty of over 40 pure essential oils
Learn about scent layering and how to create your own essential oil blends at home
Step-by-step guidance on how to make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle
Locally produced refreshments

Investment per person ~ $125. Bookings essential. Suitable for ages 14 years and over. Not recommended if you're pregnant due to the nature of some essential oils.

Please note that your candle will need to cure overnight and will be available for either pickup from Wellington Apothecary or we can courier it to you (cost of courier included in workshop fee). Thank you.

____

Cancellation policy
If you can no longer attend the workshop please contact us at least 72 hours prior for a full refund. If you cancel within 72 hours we can only provide a refund or move you to another date, if we're able to rebook your spot. Thank you.

description:
Women's MINDSET Self-Defence Workshop - Wellington, Women's MINDSET Self-Defence Workshop - Wellington
Our women's workshop is probably the most intense, comprehensive, enjoyable & hands-on self-defence syllabus in New Zealand & Australia.

About this Event

The workshop is rated R13 so only those aged 13 and above can attend due to the content taught. There are a limited amount of spaces available so book early.

Don't let the price deceive you; we're firm believers that every woman and family deserves the opportunity to participate in workshops like this without having to break the bank.

So, what sort of things can you expect to learn at this workshop?

You learn the vital parts of the body - parts of the body that are vulnerable & easy to attack.
Learn how to block an attack confidently.
Learn how to defend yourself against slaps, punches, pushes & grabs.
Learn to defend yourself against headlocks, hair grabbing, and wrist grabs.
Learn how to defend yourself against chokeholds, and bear hugs.
Learn how to defend yourself on the ground.
Learn effective rape defence techniques.
Learn how to use your hands, legs, knees & elbows as weapons.
Learn to defend yourself against many other types of attacks with confidence.

Plus, lots, lots more. (depending on the time allowed & the participant's progression)
What we teach is how to deal with the worst-case scenario, when the awareness, avoidance and de-escalation have failed, it all turns physical, there's no obvious way to escape & you must fight back.

"... a massive shout out to Charlie Riley for all the amazing work he does. Charlie, you are a champion among champions. Thank you. Ladies, if you loved #reebokunleashed or if you missed out, please check out Charlie and find a course near you."
Zoe Bell - Hollywood Stunt Woman, Actress & Producer

This is the sixteenth year that we've been running our women's workshop for the community in New Zealand and this is the second year in Australia. All you need to take with you is a positive attitude, comfortable clothing, a drinks bottle & towel plus something to eat during the breaks. Please note that the workshop takes people out of their comfort zone & can be both physically & mentally demanding at times if unsure seek your doctor's advice before undertaking any form of physical training or have a word with the instructor.

For more details contact Charlie (MINDSET Self Defence & Close Quarters Combat) at:
Email: | Mobile: +61 451 900 676

description:
Plants and Human Health - Guided Walk, Plants and Human Health - Guided Walk
What are the connections between kōwhai and lung health; tōtara and eye health; yew, flax and cancer suppression; pōhutukawa, koromiko and gut health; and more. In this one-hour downhill walk we will ‘get up close’ to both native and exotic plants to talk about these connections.

Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

- Colour and form

This course is for all levels - beginners to advanced. Basic materials provided.

description:
Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings, Evolve and advance your jewellery-making abilities with exciting lost wax methods to create rings cast in copper, brass, bronze, white bronze and silver - beginners welcome! All material costs included in course fee.

Description
In this fresh 6-week jewellery-making course, you get a hands-on opportunity to develop new techniques creating rings with a sculptural and organic flair.

The lost wax process offers a wide range of creative outcomes such as 3D forms and textures, which are not achievable with fabrication techniques.

You will design and create a pair of rings in jeweller’s wax. These wax masters will be cast professionally for you, outside class, making them in metals of your choice - copper, brass, yellow bronze or white bronze.

Later in the course you will refine your new wax shaping skills and develop a ring to be cast in sterling silver!

In the second part of the course, you will sand and refine your casts into finished jewellery.

The class offers beginners a fun introduction to jewellery making, and for those with some jewellery experience it offers a great way to advance and expand your making techniques to new levels.

All materials included in course fee. Please bring pen and paper and your reading glasses (if you use these) and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Evolve your jewellery-making abilities with new and exciting lost wax methods
- Develop and create unique sculptural ring designs
- Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting
- Sculpt and model soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting
- Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting
- File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

6 weeks, Thu 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Thorn Richards.
$299.00 incl. GST

description:
Hands-on Sourdough Workshop, Sourdough for Beginners - $120 (paid via internet banking)
Come join us for a hands-on, in-person sourdough workshop at Willow Corner Collective headquarters (aka my home)! This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Whether you're a seasoned baker or a beginner, this event is perfect for anyone looking to master the art of making sourdough bread, learning from someone who has 10+ years of experience. Perhaps you've found all the Youtube tutorials and Instagram how-to's overwhelming and are keen to learn via an in-person class. Then this is for you! I've baked hundreds of loaves in the last year alone, sold at a market, and hosted a pop-up shop. However, my passion really lies with teaching others to bake their own sourdough in their own homes, for their own families (or small businesses - one day!).You will be taught, demonstrated to, and then you get to have a go yourself; whilst learning my tips and tricks along the way. Plus we finish by sampling some delicious, fresh artisan sourdough with some favourite toppings!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread:
Knowledge
Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide
Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough
Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends
Confidence to continue the process yourself
Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home
Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only
Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking. If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket. I am happy for you to send someone in your place, though. In extenuating circumstances I may be able to hold your ticket for a future workshop; this is decided on a case-by-case basis.
*Payment to clear in bank account two days after ticket bought, after which time your ticket will be released on to someone else. Please pay immediately upon purchasing ticket.
**All workshop info you need to know ahead of time is in the confirmation email. Please ensure you read this down to the bottom.
***I recommend you already have a pair of digital scales, and a cast iron dutch oven at home to bake your loaf with as this makes the best, artisan sourdough, with great rise. Alternatively, a large, lidded casserole dish or enamel roasting pan work also. (The lids are a necessity).

"Sarah’s sour dough class is for real life! Achieve beautiful delicious bread easily in your own kitchen. Sarah teaches you how to fit sourdough into your busy life. She clearly and passionately gives the essential information, tips and tricks to make your own loaf. I loved getting to have a go at each step in the process. I love Sarah’s catchy philosophy “The goal is good bread, not perfect bread.” This took all the pressure off, for me, and I left the class empowered with all the knowledge and skills needed to give it a go at home. I appreciated the thoughtful and well prepared resources Sarah gave us. Thank you!" - Megan

"Sourdough with Sarah was a delight! From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease." -Melody
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where you'll learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30-year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. whichever you choose instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment. It's important that the app/programme is installed on the student's device before the course begins, and that they have had a play on it to get used to how it works. This is so that the student is at least a little familiar with their chosen software so that it's enough to begin learning animation techniques on day one. Additional information found at our website.

Ross will advise you on a variety of animation apps/programmes available online to use, ranging in price from free to not very much. Note - A computer mouse can be used for 2D animation, but digital pens are much easier to use. Prior to the course commencing, you'll receive details of recommended programmes to use for the course.

Suitable for a range of ages, from teens to adults.

description: Floral Therapy - A Wild Bouquet Workshop, Join us for a hands-on floral workshop where nature, creativity, and intentional design come together. Led by Jade — a floral designer with a background in natural health — you’ll learn how to create a garden-style hand-tied bouquet using seasonal blooms and healing herbs. We’ll explore bouquet-building techniques, flower symbolism, and how to work with nature’s rhythms in your design process. No prior experience needed — just bring your curiosity and love for flowers.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Bikespace - Road Ready Workshop, With the arrival of Spring what better time to get your bike ready for the road.
We’re continuing our series of one hour workshops targeted at those who want to learn a bit more about how their bike works and how to maintain & repair it to keep it running at its best.
This workshop is more general than some of our other more topic specific sessions. We will cover:
* Road Readiness. A front to back check for safety and performance
* Drivetrain tuning and maintenance
* Brake tuning and maintenance
* Tyres & Tubes. Pressures and repair.
Sunday, September 21st from 9:00am to 10:00am at the Bikespace workshop.
We'll spend most of the hour with interactive learning followed by time to work on individuals bicycles. To allow hands-on participation we are limiting the numbers to this workshop to 8 people and their bikes. Please indicate in the comments if you would like to attend and we will confirm attendees for this session.
We have a number of people indicate interest and then not attend the session. Please make every effort to attend if you sign up.
Due to our lack of covered outdoor space there is always the possibility that we have to reschedule if the weather is really uncooperative.
Bikespace is a Wellington City Council initiative allowing us to offer all our services at no cost to participants.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Musicality Workshop Series Part II – Understanding the Music, Come to this workshop and look at the relationship between the dance and the music. Find out what makes the different dance types unique and how the music contributes to these distinctions.
The workshop will also look at how musicians think and how dancers can better relate to the music through this thinking. Simply put, come and learn the language of "Musician"!
Date: Saturday, 13 September 2025
Time: 2:30-5:30pm
Cost: $40
Location: Level 2, 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington
Afternoon tea included
This workshop is the second of our four-part series in Musicality. The other workshops cover musical appreciation, engaging the music, and finally embodying the music. While all parts build on the learning of the other parts of the series, they also stand alone. The first part is not a prerequisite for attending this course.
Partners not required although always most very welcome.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Family Watercolour Art Class - Grey Day at Petone Wharf, In this class all the family can share 2 hours of creative fun together and grown ups can join in for youth price of $25. All materials supplied including quality watercolour paper, just arrive empty handed and two hours they will have a completed painting. No previous art experience is required as these workshops are suitable for both beginners and artists who’d like to fine tune their skills and style a little further. Don’t worry about drawing as this will be done so we can focus on the joys of watercolour painting. A step-by step teaching style is used and this all happens in a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable classroom overlooking the harbour.

Check out other classes, each has a different subject to choose from, Also available are Saturday family art classes as well as Wine & Watercolour evenings on Friday and Saturday evenings.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Torch Fired Enamels - 4 Weeks course, This is a 4 week's block focusing on beautiful glass enamels on copper and silver using the Torch Fired Glass Enamel technique. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work! The course starts on Sun 4 October and runs for 4 weeks until 25 October, 10am-1pm.

Beginners to jewellery work can use pre-formed shapes to apply their enamels to so they can focus on creating an excellent result. They will be shown how to apply textures and small alterations to the pieces using either hammers or roll printed textures before prepping the metal for the glass enamel.

Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced piece, exploring more complex techniques such as cloisonne.

High quality silver findings are supplied for one to two projects and more are available to purchase if required.

Sterling silver chains are also available if you want to complete the finish of a pendant.

Build your foundational jewellery making skill with this deep dive into enamel technique!

Beginners and advanced students are welcome.

This half-day course is ideal for people who are looking after children in their own home or for those needing to renew their Child First Aid certificate.

description:
Journey to Self through Art, Journey to Self through Art
You are invited to attend workshops with Rebecca Sinclair of Camellia Healing Art to be guided to the very essence of who you are. Learn to create space to truly understand what it is your soul wants you to know. Each workshop will introduce you to at least two intuition building activities that will delight a different sense each month. Every workshop is a build on the last but also a new beginning should you be joining for the first time.

Allow yourself to create a beautiful space to truly honour your very essence through anchoring deeply through grounding in nature. You need no artistic experience. Art is the medium and vehicle to learn and grow.

The first hour will be spent with a channelled message and healing drawing for the group by Camellia, followed by at least two exercises in raising frequency, working towards bringing alignment and fine tuning intuition. The second hour will be spent creating drawings from your very essence with time for discussion at the end.

COST: $30.00

description:
DIY Oracle Card Deck Workshop, Local artist and green witch, Carissa, takes you on a journey to create a customised deck of Oracle Cards.
During this magic-filled workshop you'll:
- create a powerful, personalised deck of Oracle Cards
- learn about the history behind Oracle + Tarot Cards
- learn how to read your cards and use them as a tool of self-reflection
- channel sacred message from your guides to add to your deck
- be inspired by artist-created Oracle + Tarot decks from all over the world
- tap into your personal cultural lineage to harness symbols with generational power
This workshop is great for folk at all levels of artistic skill! It's also child-friendly.
All materials are provided and you'll be supported in your creation process from start to finish.

description:
Contemporary Realism, Whether you work from objects, the figure, or secondary sources, this is an opportunity to explore working more loosely, using oils or acrylics.

Justine will guide you through drawing and painting exercises to help loosen you up, and will discuss art historical techniques that may be relevant to your individual artistic style and context.

This course will increase your ability to represent perceived objects in a dynamic, painterly way. You will be guided through drawing and painting exercises to help you achieve accuracy of form, working loosely with oils and acrylics to create fresh contemporary paintings. The emphasis is on working with your chosen source material to create a `next level’ painting. This course is for those who have explored some of the basics of painting such as mixing colours, blending etc, but want to find a process that best expresses your unique approach and ideas. Skills learnt in class can be applied across all genres.

Materials are not included in this course. Please bring your preferred range of oils, brushes and supports (paper, canvas, or board). A good basic set of oil paints would include cad and lemon yellow, ultramarine and cerulean blue, and cad red and alizarin crimson. Also, black and white. Inverlochy will supply Liquin and odourless turps. Please also bring a photocopied reference image in both black and white and
colour.

Lunch break - 30 minutes. Bring a water bottle and packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy house or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery - 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival: Our Fair Ladies (April 2025), Our Fair Ladies Tour
Embark on a captivating journey through the history buried in Karori Cemetery with our tour showcasing the remarkable lives of Wellington's women.
This tour offers a unique opportunity to celebrate the resilience, creativity and empowerment of women at a time when a woman couldn't have a bank account in her own name.  You'll hear the stories of women who had a range of interesting occupations. 
Be inspired by the incredible impact of these women's lives in early Wellington.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day by 9am by email and on our Facebook page.

Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
We will meet before the tour at the Shelter (listed as Historic chapel on the map)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

description:
Georgina Beyer – Diamonds are Forever, Georgina Beyer – Diamonds are Forever
STARTS: 1pm, SUNDAY 5 OCT

In 2004, Georgina Beyer, the first openly transgender Member of Parliament in the world, famously confronted members of Destiny Church during the Enough Is Enough rally on the grounds of Parliament.

Never a bystander, Georgina faced down the bigots, telling them straight, “Your hatred is totally intolerable!” This was just one of many significant moments that shaped the life of the extraordinary Georgina Beyer.

Born in Wellington, Georgina went on to have an unprecedented local, national and international impact through her commitment to equality and her desire to give everyone the opportunity to reach their full potential in society.

Join us for this special 90-minute walking tour as we pay tribute to the late Georgina (1957–2023) by visiting locations around central Wellington that shaped her journey. Along the way, we’ll honour some of her heroes and listen to first-hand archival audio clips that showcase her humour and resilience.

Georgina’s story is defiantly optimistic – confronting hardship and using her lived experience to change the world for the better.

Time/Date: 1pm, Sunday 5 October 2025

Starts: meet outside St Peters Church, 211 Willis Street

Ends: Vivian Street

Duration: 90 minutes

Cost / Bookings: the tour is free but you do need to register here: https://walktoursnz.wordpress.com/book/

Accessibility information: the tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to approximately 20 walkers.

Image courtesy of the amazing Kym Strathdee

description: Sketch at Chapman-Taylor's historic cafe and inn, Let's meet at this carefully restored building designed by one of New Zealand's leading architects of the early to mid 20th century, James Chapman-Taylor. You'll also be close to Old St Pauls, the Anglican Cathedral and Parliament. We can then meet around 12pm at Chapman-Taylors for coffee / lunch. See you there!

description:
Suffrage Day Walking Tour Bolton Street Cemetery, It's Suffrage Day on Friday 19 September, marking the day in 1893 when New Zealand became the first self-governing country in the world to grant women the right to vote in parliamentary elections.

To celebrate our pioneer women, and those who signed the Suffrage Petition in 1893, we're taking a walk through the cemetery, talking about the roles of settler women from 1840 onwards.

We'll meet at the Seddon Memorial at the top of the cemetery (by Anderson Park) in time to set off at 11.00am, and we'll finish at the Museum in Bolton Street about 12.30pm.

This tour is suitable for all ages, but full mobility is required. Cost $10 per person, children under 12 free, and good dogs on leads welcome.

description:
Futuna Lecture Series 2025: Francis Kéré, The Futuna Lecture Series commenced in 2011 and has been one of the main annual events on the NZ Architectural calendar for the last 14 years. It is the Futuna Chapel Trust’s major fundraiser each year and attracts a large audience of architects, architectural designers, technicians, architecture and design students and interested members of the public. The Trust exists solely on koha/donations as well as financial support from selected sponsors and donors.
Our sponsors, Dulux NZ, APL, Plytech, Warren Trust and the Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington NZIA branches have continued their support for the Futuna Lecture Series 2025.
This year the Trust welcomes three new sponsors being Roofing Industries Limited, AGP and Big River Panels. The additional support of these new sponsors is very much appreciated and ensures that the Futuna Chapel Trust can continue to attract speakers to NZ of a similar calibre to that of the 2025 Futuna Lecture, Francis Kéré.
The Trust takes this opportunity to thank Metalcraft Roofing for their support of the Futuna Lecture Series from 2012 - 2024.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work and well as that of the Kéré Foundation.
The Trust will donate 20% of the ticket income to the Kéré Foundation to support the work of Francis Kéré in Gando, Burkina Faso.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all funds raised from the Futuna Lecture Series go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust. Please register using the ticket types of $10, $15, $25 or $30 GST inclusive. Booking fees are in addition to the ticket prices.
BOOKINGS ARE ESSENTIAL TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
There will be 15 Design CPD points available for NZ registered architects attending the event. Please include your NZRAB registration number when purchasing Architect tickets

https://forms.gle/fernCvWAwM9hhG3M7
If all 30 places are taken you will receive an email letting you know of your spot on the waiting list. Likewise, if you have signed up and can no longer attend, you can email jkaiwawlg@gmail.com and let us know.

description:
Having Heard a Glow – Lewis Vivian Cosgrave, Here, everything was aglow - and everything was connected by a web of invisible thread… and this morning, a new strand - fine, but still perceptible - pulled lightly at her heels…
Lewis Vivian Cosgrave (Ngāti Pūkenga, b.1997) is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based artist primarily focused on the experience of the quotidian, a life found along concrete pavements and inner city gardens, his works blend an interest in painting, drawing and photographic practices. Cosgrave works to find intentional reticence through the alteration of collected and personal archive imagery. Erasing, saturating and muddying with a refined sense of surface and delicate use of colour, arriving eventually to a space that grants us momentary reflection on the ordinary rhythms of daily life.
A short story by Lucy Clara accompanies the show.
Opening Friday, 26 September at 5pm – kindly sponsored by Duncan’s Brewing, Almighty and The Garden Table. The exhibition runs from 27 September – 18 October 2025 at Twentysix Gallery.

description:
Book Launch - South by South by Charles Ferrall, Join us to celebrate the publication of Charles Ferrall's South by South: New Zealand and the Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration. The book will be launched by Harry Ricketts.

- Thursday 18 September, 6pm
- Unity Books Wellington
- Free event – all welcome!

Joseph Kinsey is not a name many of us know – or not as well as we know the name Robert Falcon Scott. But from his base in Christchurch, Kinsey – book and art collector, philanthropist, science enthusiast, businessman – forged deep connections with the Antarctic expeditions and the explorers themselves through his tireless work as the agent for various expeditions. Two other New Zealanders also formed close friendships: Charles Bowen, a former politician, and Wellington lawyer Leonard Tripp, to whom Shackleton declared: ‘I love you as David and Jonathan loved.’

South by South tells the story of New Zealand’s role in ‘the Heroic Age’, that wave of exploration beginning at the end of the nineteenth century in which men set out to traverse the continent of Antarctica and, if they survived, to bring home their findings. The members of this New Zealander triumvirate were all believers in the British Empire, but the southern voyages were to an uninhabited land.

South by South brings to light many letters, newspaper articles, and pieces of official correspondence, much of which has not been published before, during the five expeditions of 1901–1916: the Discovery, Nimrod, Terra Nova, Aurora, and Endurance. In particular, Scott’s letters to Kinsey and Shackleton’s to Tripp tell of their hope, despair, exhaustion, and deep gratitude for their friendship. What they and the explorers wrote was influenced by nineteenth-century adventure stories which conveyed the Imperialist ideals of the time. If the impending conflict of 1914–18 was a very ‘literary war’, this was a very literary exploration.

Charles Ferrall is an associate professor at Te Herenga Waka–Victoria University of Wellington. Among his books are Modernist Writing and Reactionary Politics (2001); The Trials of Eric Mareo (2002), co-written with Rebecca Ellis; East by South: China in the Australasian Imagination (2006), co-edited with Paul Millar and Keren Smith; Juvenile Literature and British Society 1850–1950 (2009), co-written with Anna Jackson; Henry Lawson in New Zealand (2012); How We Remember: New Zealanders and the First World War (2014), co-edited with Harry Ricketts; and Remembering Gallipoli: Interviews with New Zealand Gallipoli Veterans (2015), co-edited with Christopher Pugsley.

Cover photograph: The ship Discovery leaving Lyttelton Harbour, 1901. Alexander Turnbull Library, Wellington, New Zealand
Cover design: Spencer Levine

description:
(Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down, Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
Reflections on the future
Join Chris at the National Library to mark the end of his time in the role with his reflections on the future of Aotearoa New Zealand poetry and readings from special guests.
"I left the doors to the past and the future unlocked ... "
Chris Tse’s three-year term as Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate ends on Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, when the next Poet Laureate will be announced: https://www.nzbookawards.nz/nat.../2016-national-poetry-day/
About the speakers
Chris Tse (he/him) was born and raised in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He studied film and English literature at Victoria University of Wellington, where he also completed an MA in Creative Writing at the International Institute of Modern Letters. In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate. His poetry, short fiction, and non-fiction have been recorded for radio and widely published in numerous journals, magazines and anthologies. He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
Ken Arkind is an American poet, author, performer, and educator originating from Steamboat Springs in Colorado. He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion. Ken now resides in Auckland and is a recent graduate from the Manukau Institute of Technology’s Creative Arts Programme.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music. Her poems started being published in her junior years of high school, and her debut chapbook anomalia was published by We Are Babies Press in April 2022. Her writing takes inspiration from antique stores, Tumblr text posts, and dead poets.
Gregory O’Brien is a poet, painter, author, curator, and editor. His most recent poetry publication is a collection of poems and paintings, House and contents (2022). Other recent publications include a book-length meditation on the Pacific, Always song in the water (2019) and the Ockham award winning book Don Binney: Flight Path (2023).

From Parliament through Te Aro to Newtown, the locations on this tour are imbued with life. Enjoy an Eat Your Art Out High Tea (included in your ticket price) while hearing Lyndee-Jane speak on leadership, legacy, creation, impact and theatre that changes the world.
Reviewed as “Succession meets Barbie” by Showcase Victoria, Monument explores the role that makeup and fashion play in how we perceive and receive women in power. Edith Aldridge is the youngest woman to be elected leader of her country. In a lush presidential suite, she has just ninety minutes to get ready for the most monumental day of her life. But things are not going to plan. Due to heavy fog, her team is stuck in another city. Enter Rosie, a twenty-two year old makeup artist from the David Jones counter, sent last minute to help Edith get camera ready.
From very different worlds, these two women, though face to face, do not see eye to eye in this provocative, slick and funny play that is “sparkling fresh and urgently of the now”.

FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format.
The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.”
Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon.

description:
Octavia - A VATS Production!, COME TO OUR CLOSING NIGHT FOR A DIRECTOR Q&A!

Welcome back to another night of ancient theatre with the one and only Victoria Ancient Theatre Society! VATS is a student-led club at Victoria University of Wellington that puts on an ancient play annually, celebrating the fusion of Classical Studies and Theatre, to learn from, and to experience in full. This years' experience comes in the form of the Roman tragedy Octavia—the only extant Roman play set in the eternal city of Rome.

Often attributed to Seneca, but likely in truth penned by an unknown playwright we know as Pseudo-Seneca under the Flavian dynasty, Octavia is a hard tragedy depicting the divorce and hardships of the titular Octavia—the first wife of Emperor Nero.

Follow our tragic heroine as she bears the weight of her Julio-Claudian family name and all the expectations that are thrust upon her with it. Bear witness the cruelty of Emperor Nero and his crimes driven by an unbridled and unabated passion. Experience the illustriousness of a grand imperial wedding and follow it with the bloodied remains left by the ruthlessness of Roman politics. Shall Octavia survive this brutal game? Come find out, for you are cordially invited...
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Murder Mystery 'Interactive', Murder Mystery 'Interactive'
Murder Mystery ‘Gatsby’ is the world’s first ever fully interactive theatre show, where every guest in the theatre gets to become a detective for the evening and try to solve the mystery of who killed the infamous stage director Larry Lugosi.

Set to a Gatsby theme, all guests are encouraged to come dressed in the glam of the 1920’s. Dress up is not compulsory but it does add to the immersive experience. No acting is required as the cast members of the show are the suspects, and guests get multiple opportunities throughout the evening to interact with the suspects to work out which one of them is the Murderer.

There is a reason this is NZ's longest running comedy show, so get ready to laugh in the face of Murder, as this show is a side splitting comedy with some guests even complaining that their “face hurt from laughing so much”. Others have said... “Haven’t laughed that much in ages, thanks guys and girls” and “Thanks team for such a great night!! We came last night and that’s the best fun I have ever had”.

Get a group of friends together, grab your costumes and book now for the latest sensation in live entertainment. But beware! There are many distractions along the way to keep you from solving this dastardly deed!

Grab a bite from our food trucks, sip on coffee from the on-site cart, or treat yourself to fresh artisan baked goods while you browse.

💳 Payments:
Most stalls offer cash and EFTPOS options, but we recommend bringing some cash just in case.

👯‍♀️ Bring a friend (or two!) and enjoy a relaxed day out in one of Wellington’s most scenic suburbs. Support local, discover something beautiful, and soak up the Spring vibes at this much-loved community event.

description:

Get ready, Wellington — the Creepy Cute Market is coming back to town!

Where: Thistle Hall, Upper Cuba Street, Wellington
Indulge your love for the weird, whimsical, and wonderfully wicked at a market where spooky meets sweet. After a hauntingly successful run last time, we're thrilled to return with even more delightfully dark treasures for all you macabre-loving misfits.
Expect:
Spine-tingling art & prints
Spooktacular fashion & accessories
Morbidly cute homewares

description:
Not Your Nana's Craft Market - R18 Art and Craft Market, *Strictly R18*
Are you ready for a unique and thrilling experience? Look no further! We invite you to the most captivating event of the year - the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!

What to Expect
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Join Us!

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less

description:
The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!, The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!
And now for something completely different…
Prepare yourself for a day of absurd antics, ridiculous competitions, and nonsensical fun as The Bond Store descends into Monty Python–inspired mayhem.

💰 Entry is FREE!
But to join the day’s silliness, games, and glorious nonsense, we will be asking for a donation to Kāpiti Golf for Good – a Lions & Rotary initiative.

👑 Gather your knights, twits, and lumberjacks for:

🕺 The Ministry of Silly Walks Competition

🩸 The Black Knight’s Limb Toss (just a flesh wound)

🎩 The Upper-Class Twit of the Year Race

🐴 The Two-Person Coconut Horse Race

🌲 The Lumberjack Song Karaoke (he’s okay!)

🧠 The Monty Python Quiz (bring your brain, or a dead parrot)

🏆 Prizes to be won, dignity to be lost.

But that’s not all! Beware of French guards at the gate, pop into the Argument Tent (“This isn’t an argument!”), and expect confusion, silliness, and possibly a Spanish Inquisition (though nobody expects that).

Plus: Market stalls and Monty Python–themed drinks at the bar.

Plus Steve Poulton live music from 4.30pm.

So grab your coconuts and gallop to The Bond Store for a day you won’t forget (no matter how hard you try).

Kindly stuff your pockets with good old-fashioned cash (none of that funny monopoly money) to hurl generously at the ‘Golf is Good’ charity in exchange for your entry into the day’s utterly ridiculous games

WE ARE LOOKING FOR TEAMS AND INDIVIDUALS TO ENTER THE EVENTS - IF YOU ARE KEEN - YOU NEED TO BE QUICK:

description:
Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025, Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025
Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025!
Now in its 22nd year, the Fête offers shoppers loads of inspiration. Stallholders will be selling festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, as well as flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.
Gourmet food is also a highlight – with freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries and icecream available for purchase. Devonshire Tea served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular home baking stall features again this year, and visitors are encouraged to get in early as the Christmas cakes, in particular, often sell out by midday.
The beauty of this Fête is it is a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus indoor and outdoor stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children with face painting and three magic shows during the day to round out the fun.
Visitors can meander around the beautiful campus and enjoy the unique surroundings including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.
The Christmas Fête is the school’s biggest fundraiser of the year and comes about thanks to an amazing collaboration between the Friends of Rathkeale College, staff and students.
Koha/gold coin entry
Eftpos available but we strongly recommend bringing cash.
More information: https://rathkeale.school.nz/community/#friends-of-rathkeale

On land, the iconic boatsheds and Mana Island backdrop set the vibe with music, food, and good times. The Hui is about more than just competition — it’s about celebrating the Bay and bringing whānau and friends together.

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival 2025 | GREGORY PORTER, Hailed as one of the most influential artists of his generation, two-time GRAMMY Award-winning jazz vocalist, composer and bandleader Gregory Porter appears in Aotearoa for the first time at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
Since his breakout album Liquid Spirit on Blue Note Records, which sold over a million copies and earned him his first GRAMMY Award for Best Jazz Vocal Album in 2014, he’s captivated audiences worldwide with his soulful baritone vocals and dynamic storytelling.
Influenced by Bakersfield Southern Gospel and jazz legend Nat King Cole, Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul and gospel with a presence that commands attention from the very first note.
A defining voice in contemporary jazz, experience his 'liquid gold' vocals, warmth, and magnetic stage presence at St James Theatre, for one night only.

description:
Jazz Festival: John Rae’s BOP-IT!, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

John Rae’s BOP-IT! Hard Bop with a Kiwi Twist.

Featuring a stellar lineup of Aotearoa’s finest jazz musicians, John
Rae’s BOP-IT! delivers a high-energy celebration of the hard bop era.
Rooted in the rich traditions of 1950s and 60s jazz, BOP-IT! brings new
life to classic repertoire while exploring the bold, boundary-pushing
spirit of post-bop.

With virtuosic solos, driving rhythms, and deep grooves, this will be
one of the most exhilarating performances of the festival. Hard bop has
always challenged both audiences and musicians alike—and BOP-IT! takes
it to the next level.

Featuring: John Rae Drums, Ben Wilcock Piano, Patrick Bleakley Bass, Oscar Laven Sax, Michael Taylor Trumpet.

*Dear WTCF Friends & Family,*
We are delighted to invite you to the 2025 Dussehra / Bathukamma Festival Celebration! Let’s come together to honour our vibrant traditions and rich cultural heritage — followed by a delicious dinner sponsored by WTCF.

description:
Slow Grind Fever [AUS] - Wellington Jazz Festival, Express from Melbourne, Australia and crossing international waters for the first time this October, Meow is excited to welcome the slowest, spookiest, smokiest and swingin-est club night Wellington has ever seen: 'Slow Grind Fever'.
For this one-night-only episode of SGF Wellington, founder Richie1250 (106.7 PBS FM) will be joined by fellow Melbourne radio alumnus Dr. Popalotacorn (RRR, 98.1FM Raglan) and Wellington's own belle of the airwaves Miss Juliet (RadioActive.FM Americana)
Slow Grind Fever was born in 2012 when Richie1250 hired a Russian Cultural Centre ballroom and threw a slow dance party for his 30th birthday, and it's been running as a regular monthly club night ever since. Richie and his friends play the slowest, sleaziest, spookiest, sweetest, swinginest old records they can find, and people dance real slow in a haze of smoke and dim red light. It's a good time.
In the last few years Richie has taken Slow Grind Fever on the road, with regular dances in Sydney, Hobart, Darwin and Alice Springs. They post up a monthly Slow Grind Fever mix in the week before the party every month, and have collaborated with Stag-O Lee Records in Germany on a series of Slow Grind Fever LPs and CDs.
Enjoy the music and if you feel so inclined, get down to Slow Grind Fever - Wellington at Meow on Friday 17th October.
Listening to the MP3 mixes is nice, but when you’re in the room all
wrapped up in smoke with the music sizzling right off the old records, through the speakers and into your brain, well, there's nothing quite like it…
http://www.slowgrindfever.com/
https://www.instagram.com/slowgrindfeverclub

description:
Tartan Up The Green, Tartan Up The Green
Gather up the clan and join us here at Brewtown Upper Hutt – Tartan Up The Green is back for 2025!

Are you ready to be blown away by the power of the Pipes and Drums as Tartan Up The Green returns this October 4th for another rousing rendition of Bagpiping, Highland Drumming and Dancing!

Our mates from RNZPBA Wellington Hawkes Bay are back to curate their all-new take on traditional pipe and drum comps with some of the finest musicians in the country.

Join us on The Greenspace for our very own family friendly, FREE to attend salute to those earth-shaking instruments of war (literally) and all things Highlands and Islands!

It won’t just be Pipers and Drummers competing for glory. Brewtown is delighted to welcome some bonnie boogying in the form of Scottish Highland Dancing, as dancers from up and down the country wow the crowd with traditional dance.

A true showcase of strength and stamina, Highland Dancing is highly technical and recognised as a sport by the Sport Council of Scotland…waltzing this aint!

So, get behind these incredible young athletes and show your support at this years Tartan Up The Green!

description:
Dia de los Muertos - Day of the Dead Celebration with Claudio Escutia, Dia de los Muertos - Day of the Dead Celebration with Claudio Escutia
Join Claudio for this special occasion we will be celebrating one of the most important holidays in Mexico, the day of the dead or “Dia de los Muertos”.

The Day of the Dead is one of the traditions that has remained alive throughout the centuries; the main holidays are November 1 & 2, which UNESCO designated and cataloged as an Intangible Heritage of Humanity in 2003.

This special celebration dates back to prehispanic times before the arrival of Europeans to America, and has been alive and widely celebrated over the years.

About the Day of the Dead
The Day of the Dead tradition dates back to pre-Hispanic times, when a tribute was paid to death; the tribute took place from the last week of October to the first days of November.

Prehispanic Mexicans conceived Death as the beginning of the journey to Mictlán (the Place of the Dead), during which the soul of the deceased had to overcome various obstacles before reaching Mictlantecuhtli (the Lord of the Dead) and Mictecacíhuatl (the Lady of the Dead). Upon reaching the gods of Mictlán, an offering had to be made to them in order to obtain eternal rest.

What to Expect
Claudio will explain why it is important to celebrate and take the time to honour and remember the members of your family, ancestors and loved ones who have passed away. He will also explain the mysticism and spirituality around the Day of the Dead celebration.

We’ll also learn how to set up your ofrenda, or altar, and which elements are important for it (as well their meaning).

It's very common for an ofrenda of the dead to be placed inside Mexican homes, decorated with papel picado, food, traditional sweets, and photos of loved ones. Candles and marigold flowers are also placed as a sign of welcome for our loved ones.

Feel free to bring photos of your beloved ones that have passed away, fruits and flowers for the altar and anything that your beloved ones valued / loved when they were here with us. We will place those on the altar.

The Evening’s Schedule
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.

An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions and drums sounds.

History of the day of the dead celebration.

Explanation of the altar, and the main elements for an ofrenda.

Storytelling: learn of Mexican legends like Catrinas and Xoloitzcuintle (the Mexican dog that helps the dead to find their way to Mictlan, the Aztec underword).

Remembering and sharing histories about the loved ones that passed away (optional but encouraged)

Traditional Mexican chants for remembering the loved ones

Atole de Chocolate, a traditional prehispanic drink - amazing in flavour, consumed cold or hot

Music to invoke emotion and imagery of contemplative natural and mystical environments

Finish with a shamanic atmosphere of relaxation and traditional chants.

Details
When: Saturday 1 November, 7pm -9pm

Where: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing - Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington CBD.

Investment: $55 (first 5 enrolments - $45!); Children under 16 years old - $35

Haere Mai!
Everyone is welcome including kids (see special pricing). No previous experience or knowledge is required. As this is an evening of learning and exploration, come wearing comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and mind willing to learn and receive.

description:
NZ Mountain Film Festival 2025 - Awards Night, A collection of New Zealand-made mountain films - brought to you by the Vic Uni Tramping Club, Wellington Tramping and Mountaineering Club, and of course the New Zealand Mountain Film and Book Festival!

Awards Night: Thursday 25 Sep (doors open at 6:00pm, films start at 6:30pm):

- Footprints on Katmai (22 mins) Max Romey, USA. Following his grandmother's footsteps to one
of the most remote and bear-strewn beaches in Alaska, painter Max Romey discovers that an
ocean of problems is closer to home than he could have imagined. BEST FILM ON THE ENVIRONMENT
- Alone Across Gola (20 mins) Jude Kriwald, UK, NZ Premiere. Stranded in Liberia’s Gola
rainforest, filmmaker Jude Kriwald faces hunger, isolation, robbery and disappearing trails. A raw
tale of one man’s solo, self-filmed journey chasing a childhood dream. With only a bike and a
tent, Jude pushes the limits of survival and self-discovery. BEST ADVENTUROUS SPORTS & LIFESTYLES
- Zahir (36 mins) Julien Nadiras, Switzerland, subtitles. Katherine and Eline take on an iconic rock
route, accessing it by bike. Their all-eco ascent tests endurance, nerve, and friendship, with long
runouts and tiny holds pushing them to the edge.
- Body of a Line (10 mins) Henna Taylor, subtitles, USA. A cleverly animated short film that
morphs into real life as Madaleine undertakes an intimate and creative journey to climb a difficult
rock route, with original music and poetry. BEST SHORT FILM
- Trango (46 mins) Leo Hoorn, USA. After a two-year attempt, ski mountaineers ski the first
descent of the Great Trango Glacier. They navigate risk, grapple with grief, and face physical
danger as they push the limits of human experience. Unspoken trust and support within their
expedition team allows them to face the unimaginable together. GRAND PRIZE FILM

Total running time: 120 minutes + 15 minute intermission.
